While working for them, they changed their software/hardware for workers to clock in/out. It ended up causing a lot of problems because those in charge of the system were completely unaware of how to use/fix anything. I had four consecutive checks that were wrong in some way. It really seemed like a matter of someone not taking care of a problem when it arose, but instead just passing it along without addressing it.

pros: I love the job and company I was placed in. This is the ONLY reason I am still with Adecco.
cons: I have worked in the same place the entire time I have been employed through Adecco. I found out shortly after being hired another employee I trained through Adecco was making more than me for the same job. After working there for more than 9 months, I found out everyone else that had been hired on after me was also being paid more than me. I found out the contact had gotten changed to give employee more money, everyone except me apparently. I'm training these people and they're being paid more than me.  I call Adecco, and they finally raise my pay to the same as theirs. That's not fair.

job_title: IT Administrative in Saint Paul, MN
pros: Beneficial to get the experiences in applications/systems, work within the company you are "contracted" to gain corporate environment experiences, project migration and database system experiences, and quick hire process to fill in positions.
cons: Have worked x amount of years and still haven't been officially hired onto the company that am "contracted"... Little to no room to move up on positions. Benefits and pay needs to be worked on and they do not match the amount of work put in.

pros: Not much to say other than GE has been great to me, but Adecco has been horrible.
cons: Adecco treats their employees pretty poorly.  I was already at GE before Adecco came along and they just happened to get the contract for me, but the way they treat their employees is pretty terrible.  I have been given 3 promotions but they have neglected to announce any of them and have put me in a bad position with my peers where I have had to tell my peers to report to me which is very uncomfortable.  The leadership is extremely bad at communication and after speaking to many Adecco employees I see that I am not the only one who is under satisfied with how leadership at Adecco treats people.

review_title: working as temp at Melville Corporate headquarters
pros: Pretty fair in terms of pay for a temp position and great if you work in their headquarters in Melville, but be prepared to be disappointed if you are seeking a permanent position. My 1st promised "temp-to-perm" position never became permanent and I was working there for about 9 mths, but my manager was great.
cons:
My 2nd position was only strictly temp with minimal chance of becoming permanent and it was also a nightmare because my direct report to manager was a horrible manager.

Corporate positions are only available to colleagues (those already holding permanent position with Adecco), but temps working at Adecco corporate are not eligible to apply).

review_title: Typical Staffing Agency, depends on where you are placed
pros: Depends largely on which company you are contracted out to. My experience has been positive, promoted many times over the past year. Work hard, look for ways to improve both yourself and the organization and your efforts will be recognized
cons: lots of CYA rather than actual improvements and innovations. Difficult to be a change agent. Benefits are poor, no 401k matching, medical is also poor, benefits in general are not very good. Overall compensation isn't great either. Working for this company is a good way to gain experience and then find a new job as a salaried employee with greater long term potential.

pros: I worked as a recruiter for Adecco for 2 years. Overall the experience was good. You have the ability to make a good amount of money on commission. You also have the opportunity to make connections throughout the local community.
cons: Since the economy is getting better, companies are starting to get away from agency recruiting. Also, there tends to be more of a revolving door with agency recruiting. If you have a manager who does not actively sell Adecco services, your pocketbook will be impacted. Also, Adecco has a lot of national accounts, which means a very long recruiting process. You can lose your candidates during this process. Little to no career advancement.

job_title: Customer Service- Call Center Representative in Melbourne, FL
pros: Working for Adecco is great because you can learn SO many new professional techniques that can really have a positive impact on your work life. The pay rate through Adecco is pretty decent and it goes up once you advanced through positions. All in all this is a very laid back agency and is willing to care and help you at all times.
cons: Generally, speaking they can be a little unorganized and slow at times. Sometimes the staff members have bitter attitudes as but you have to stride pass their misery. Most times the hours giving can be a little outrageous! most of all i hate the 15% that is taken out on every check! watch out for that folks!

review_title: This is a well run staffing agency.
job_title: Medical Equipment Technician in Minneapolis, MN
pros: Excellent people, who are concerned with each individual.
cons: They don’t follow up on technicians that have finished contracts and let them know if there is a future plan.

review_title: Avoid. Wish I had followed my gut feeling before accepting the job offer.
pros: They're an agency 'representing' the hiring company, acting as the HR for them. They are quite relaxed, will leave you alone, will not contact you if everything is ok.  No strings attached
cons: NO training provided at all. NO personal development plan, NO space to grow - as you're a contractor. They want you come and then finish and leave. Benefits virtually don't exist, minimal pension scheme in place (up to 2%)  after 3 months, no childcare, no bonus, nothing at all. Have to accrue your own Bank Holidays and public holidays depending on how many weeks you've worked, otherwise you don't get paid for them. Confusing line management -  you'll have to contact and report to your hiring manager in the establishment, AND the Adecco representative on site.

review_title: A fantastic business to work for.
job_title: Internal Recruiter in City of London, England
pros:
Enjoying the diversity of working with 12 established recruitment brands within Adecco Group.

Inspirational senior leadership team across h/o and the individual brands alike.

Flexible management team who appreciate the work vs life balance.

Huge focus on recognition across teams of Consultants / Support staff – regular rewards ranging from top table dinners to high octane activities and trips to tropical destinations

Good opportunity to progress career wise / move across to other brands nationally and internationally.

Strong culture and a warm, friendly place to work.
cons:
Internal systems can be problematic with such a large scale organisation, although continuously improving due to significant investment.

Salaries could be looked at in certain areas in order to attract top talent.

job_title: Intake Specialist in El Segundo, CA
pros: Causal environment, manageable workload (when you finally get work), Vice President is very engaged with the department, overtime offered often, and good pay
cons: Lack of training, lack of communicate, unstructured/organized, some of the consultants (supervisors) agent very personable, new hires typically just sit around waiting to do something which can sometimes take a month (if you're a person who likes getting paid to do nothing then this is the perfect job for you), kitchen area isn't the cleanest, new hires can be easily forgotten depending on the team you're on, fast growing company, which can be a bad thing, some temps have been there a year and they're still temps (no job security) etc.

pros:
Easy to apply - also people get big jobs with no experience - trainees have a lot of responsibility
Lot of trainees
You can sit in the office all day, doing nothing you will be paid, and they won't get rid of you. You can even go out in work time to other cityies, if you said you go to a partner company they will belive it, won't check it. Trust me. You can date during working time, you can go the English lessons, go to get your nails done, or your hair etc. They just don't care if you work - though you might miss your KPI and your bonus.
cons:
Communist company
Corupt
The employees are living in frear of the management
The management does not care about the employees
If you are an employee your performance doesn't count as much if you are a friend of someone important
The KPIs are not proportinal to the positions. (Nor the bonuses)
They usually want you to do overtime without getting paid
They usually go around the law with partners

review_title: Working onsite at Google as a temp, vendor, or contractor (TVC)? Beware.
job_title: Project Manager in Mountain View, CA
pros: Health insurance is offered by Adecco, taking a temp position at Google offers an opportunity to "get your foot in the door", Adecco is responsive to questions about insurance, sick days, etc. when they come up, TVCs get access to free food and snacks onsite at Google and very cheap GBUS rides
cons: Adecco takes a large share of the contract payment for your onsite contract at Google, contract negotiation is difficult (or impossible?), healthcare is offered, but very expensive, (virtually) no PTO, only 3 days of sick leave per year, no 401k or other benefits offered, the promise of "getting your foot in the door" at Google does not guarantee conversion to full time employment at Google (in some cases, coming on as a TVC makes it harder), often TVCs work on more than what their contract states, but because of legal concern about co-employment liability, Googlers take credit for TVC work, working on-site at Google does not include many benefits afforded to Google employees (team off-sites, Grow classes, healthcare, retirement benefits, etc)

pros: Adecco has a huge network of branches and jobs – both locally and across the world – you just have to make an effort to tap into it. Senior leadership is really excited about what they do and dedicated to the company, plus they're making conscious efforts to update their processes and brand.
cons: The branches are pretty slammed, so you have to reach out to them and not wait for feedback. Jobs other than warehouse positions are sometimes forgotten because there are so many open warehouse jobs available. You pretty much need to go into the office to push your application forward.

pros: Pay is good for low skilled job
cons:
Job security 
Poor communication 
Pushed for rates - never enough
False promises
Tracked every second

pros: Adecco challenges you to learn EVERYTHING at the Branch level with little support.  You will learn how to interview, background check and manage and sell at the branch level.  You cannot only learn enough to get by.  You WILL learn everything!  Great place to challenge yourself.
cons: No real advancement to speak of.  Not a lot of respect for Branch Managers.  Lack to support by upper management.  You are on your own and left to figure everything out.  If you a quick you will not have any problems, but if you need help with your learning curve you are out of luck.

pros: I do not think that there is any good reason to work here
cons: Th company is filled with flaws in every thing be it organisation culture, remuneration, HR policies. I worked in one of the Delhi NCR branch. The branch manager there was the worst creature of the branch. No coordination was present between the employees. The branch manager use to scold its staff in a very bad manner and his favorites use to follow him the same way. There was a culture of senior staff suppressing the junior staff. I do not want to name the guy but he was of the belief to just get in fight with other staff and get the work done.

pros: Adecco is a well known company that is able to network through their contacts to find work for you. Work I looked for was in the financial services sector, although pay was not very high, sometimes just working can be more beneficial to finding future work than not working. Adecco is well known for speaking to employer on your behalf, should an issue become present at the job site.
cons: Pay may not be very high. Have to accept a lot of things.

job_title: Head of IT Production for APAC Region in Tokyo
pros:
The people! Fantastic group of skilled, motivated and generally inspirational people in the main.

The training! I have attended several of the in-house training courses and they are really amazing. Worling with colleagues from other countries, cultures and business units on interactive training exercises gives you great insights and ideas to improve your own area.

The career opportunities! Adecco truly believes in promoting from within, and also in mobility within the company. I started in France and am now based in Tokyo!
cons: I would say the main area for improvement is internal communication. Efforts are being made but word of mouth and coffee room discussions are still often the fastest and most reliable source of information.

job_title: Client Program Manager in San Diego, CA
pros: Colleagues and some of the contingent staff were fun to work with.  Very fast paced environment, exposure to many different facets to HR.  Great time off package.
cons: Lack of training.  Been with the company for a long time and there never has been any formal training program set in place other than online modules.   No extra incentive for tenured employees other than more time off.  Other than PTO, benefits package is sub par.  No company parties or holiday events from corporate, other than small events/pot lucks coordinated bu local employees

review_title: Good to get initial experience then RUN!
pros: Some level of autonomy, good initial training but only if you are nominated and depends on a division. Some divisions have no training other than shadowing and useless videos.
cons:
1. Nepotism - best accounts given to family members and favorite colleagues - FAVORITISM
2. False promises. 
3. Passive agressiveness 
4. Disengaged managements/ leaders 
5. Awful commission structure mostly at 10% for start with a draw. 
6. Micromanagement and useless KPIs
7. Unethical behavior encouraged to close a sale 
8. Shy high turnover and management openly saying they do not expect people to last
7. Major miscommunication and bait and switch practices. If you're in sales (recruiter) and it doesn't work out, YOU are at fault!

pros: I worked for Adecco off and on for 10 years. Never had a problem until my last assignment.
cons: Recruiter did not document the abuse and defamation of my character. Ignored it all. I was looking for another job since I was in a bad situation, and my recruiter told me Adecco didn't have another assignment for me. I called the regional manager that I had worked with in the past when she was a recruiter. I got a call 2 days later to interview for a great company.  My recruiter lied about there being other assignments available because she wanted me to disappear so her regional manager didn't find out that she was ignoring the horrible situation I was in at my assignment. I had to get an attorney to stop the defamation of my character, and traumatization from my assignment having me handle suicide  calls when I wasn't trained for it. Sad for Adecco to have ignored the situation.

pros: Ability to work with the largest staffing agency in the US and the world. This affords many positive opportunities. Solid organization which has done a nice job of cutting out the red tape. Organization is committed to their employees from a training and development perspective, in partcular Recruiters, on-sites and branch managers.
cons: The company is going the wrong direction!!! Very apparent to see the organization, which once had a nice balance, is now ONLY about finding a way to making more money!!! Some examples are the closing of the Melville location, not replacing individuals in key positions/segments and making foolish career decisions on solid producers. The company values of cool head, warm heart and working hands needs to be replaced with GROW THE RETURN ON SALES OR ELSE!! Senior leadership is running scared!!! Lastly salaries for branch staff is excessively low!!

review_title: Depends on the Specific Company You're Hired For
pros: Easy enough to register with them, I've had good pay every time I've worked via them (for someone under 25 anyway) but I imagine that just depends on the company who's hiring them. Both of the places I've worked at have also offered opportunities for permanent positions, albeit one only in theory (though this contract did get extended several times).
cons: Most of the downsides have been issues within specific companies but I've never had any personal problems with Adecco, although I've heard anecdotes about delays with pay etc from people I was working with at a factory which sadly give me the impression that people doing admin jobs are treated with more respect than people in factory jobs as when I had pay issues in my admin job they were resolved immediately.

pros: Okay pay. Coworkers were very nice.
cons: They let me go due to my accent and accusations that the Customers were calling complaining for me not understanding them, and keeping them over the phone more than 1 min, which is not true. I totally understood as well helped them. I was very interested in the job and they didn't give me another chance in doing chats/emails like they did give to the other employees. I felt discriminated due to my accent, and when I asked for new foams they refused to give them to me. I had to work without them until I got sick with skin infection due to stress and the dirtiness of the desks and to this day I can't pay for my medication as I am still unemployed. Such a horrible company. They are a shame to work for.

pros: Aggressive and fair commission scale.   Hard workers with good sales and good markups are rewarded for their efforts.  Good work/life balance.
cons:
Micromanagement.   The company has become involved in day to day operations of individual employees instead of allowing them to work independently.   The new COO of our division has implemented a top-down fear as a motivator approach.  

The company benefits are pitiful.  High cost for little coverage.  Many employees opt-out of employer coverage for personal coverage or coverage from a spouse's employer.

pros: I worked for Adecco on contract assignments and was hired perm.  Always had a great experience.  I saw a post that said Adecco doesn't do some things - and just places people out.  Adecco does skill testing, background / drug screening, and reference checks on Resumes - so I'm not sure where they were getting that information from.  It's unfortunate that a customer or employee would make false accusations, which makes one think there may be more to the issue and they are just giving a personal negative.  I don't think they have changed policy since I was hired a  year ago.  I would highly and do highly recommend to all my friends
cons: Just keep up the good work

review_title: Global company with good global reputation but Indian operations pathetically managed by senior leaders.
pros:
Couple of good practices followed as a part of Adecco global like community give back program.
You may be given a lot of responsibility and opportunity to take on tasks only senior management would be responsible for in other firms.
Will have the opportunity to understand the business in detail.
cons:
Top management often take unprofessional decisions not in line with what they preach. 
Very often felt HR is for Payroll processing & nothing else. Even if any suggestions are made they remain as suggestions with senior mgmt. 
Non allocation of required resource put everyone under pressure.
Performance appraisals are hopeless.
No job security

pros:
Overall quality of staff is excellent - even the crap staff are of high quality compared to other companies!
Fantastic experience - this company will teach you everything about how not to do things. Due to high turnover of staff you will be promoted quickly.f
cons:
Very poor systems, promises to replace them aren't happening.
Senior Management (UK CEO - Peter) focuses on the front office business with no understanding of what the hamsters on the wheels in back office are dealing with.
Expect excessive unpaid overtime

pros:
As a temp company goes, better than manpower but that sets the bar really low,
They we're more or less responsive to questions, and one time they even asked how my assignment was going!
cons: The problem is the contractor system not so much addeco,  you have no chance of a permanent position because addeco loses a check then the employer loses when they have to give you benefits and paid days off. You'll always be 90 days away from a real job or being laid off. At best you'll be treated as a vague caricature of a person at worst ignored, a simple mistake or a rough day will put you back another 90 days.  All this and they where surprised when I never came back from lunch

review_title: Good company, great benefits in a challenging industry
job_title: Direct Hire Recruiter in Phoenix, AZ
pros:
Benefits are exceptional (health, life, supp life, dental, 401k)
Supported by team and management.
Practical and reasonable.
Better than average Direct Hire comp plans (several to choose from)
cons:
Industry and especially Adecco suffer from local management turnover.
Not known for Direct Hire but rather Temp and temp-hire, so branding and expectations must be overcome from both clients and candidates.  In other words,  both parties think you are calling about temp or temp-hire opportunities not Direct Hire.

pros: If you don't have any other agencies to work for, they are better than nothing.
cons:
Very distorted description of positions they want to contract you to.
Lack of information, communication.
Payed far less than other agencies pay their employees for doing the same work.
Will lie to you about benefits, workloads, and pay if you let them.  They actually made me pay back a national holiday's pay!
Will not let you know in advance whether or not your contract is renewed!  Poof! It's Monday, and you are out of work!

review_title: THEY SACK YOU AT THE DROP OF A HAT AND FROG MARCH A WHOLE GROUP OF YOU OUT OF THE BULDING
pros: They have a lot of immediate starting positions so you can be placed into work pretty much straight away.
cons: Their consultants are difficult to get hold of, when you are let go of in a job they are indifferent to your suffering, the pay isn't always great and they don't inform the job centre of your job ending at the right time so you end up losing out on benefit payments under universal credit as you get paid from them within your assessment period. The most insensitive Adecco branch I worked for was the one who deals with work for a large insurance company and are themselves based in Swindon.

pros: There is nothing you won't learn. It comes at a price sometimes, but I can say with sincerity that I have overcome many of my professional weaknesses. It's a trial by fire, but if you can keep up you'll grow. It's a great experience for someone fresh out of college. I am confident in my qualifications.
cons: Low pay and not the most attractive benefits. Many branches are understaffed so I have found myself doing the workload of two recruiters in the past.  No compensation for overtime. The only advancement up Adecco's corporate ladder is through sales so unless you're looking to be a lifetime recruiter, this might not be for you.

review_title: Contract or Temporary Workers - Not Recommended
job_title: Digital Marketing Manager in Phoenix, AZ
pros: No pro's to be spoken of.
cons:
As a contractor or temporary worker, you will manage them on managing you or their internal processes.  I had to call them every week to process my time card.  And when I had travel expenses, I had to submit, then call the local office to have them approve before the expenses could move through their system.  

I never heard from the local offices unless they wanted to know if there were opportunities to provide additional resources to the client.  And heath benefits are terrible!!!!  Will never work through this company again.  There are other temp/contract companies who actually care about the people they employ - this is not one of them. So unless you are desperate, I would find other avenues or vendors for employment.

pros:
The branch manager at the downtown Chicago location was great
Once you apply for a position they contact you fairly quick
cons:
Recruiters are inexperienced 14 year old girls and have less experience than the people they are recruiting
They lie about what times you have called in and may sometimes say you did not at all
They lie to get themselves out of paying unemployment 
They have a lot of issues with paying their employees ( Had to talk to the manager a couple times to be able to receive my pay)
Will pull you out of your assignment even if you are doing well, they do not care if you are #1.
They were not involved with their employees like many other agencies, and when they did have meeting they were completely lost and did not know what they were talking about.

job_title: Senior Recruiter/On-Site Manager in Bolingbrook, IL
pros:
We had a great office dynamic which is especially hard  in the Recruiting world.
Benefits were not bad but being that they are the worlds largest staffing agency they could have been better.
cons:
I worked for this company almost 15 years and while I was headed to a work site I was hit and rushed to the emergency department. Not only did I not receive a call from upper management, they denied workman's compensation and to top it off they asked for me to resign!!!!

I gave this company my all and I do not regret it and would do it again because that is my work ethic. To this day I am very disheartened that I was treated like this.

Absolutely no work life balance. Career opportunity's were given to the "in crowd" luckily I was in.

Pay is not within line at all.

review_title: Confused management, given no clear direction of what is to be done!
job_title: Human Resources Role in Melville, NY
pros: Its very slow paced if you like that environment
cons: Management won't allow you in on Sr. level conversations/meetings no matter if your work is being presented or not.  Sr. Level mgmt is rude and give no clear direction of the work that is to be performed.  Far too many businesses that Adecco has acquired and it's because of this that your work will be very confusing because its coming from so many different areas/business lines.

review_title: You feel like just a part of a big emotionless machine... but it pays the bills.
pros:
Competitive wages for all involved
Excellent and simple hiring process of temporary or permanent employees
Micromanagement discouraged
Amazing department support (payroll, IT, etc)
18 paid days off within the first year
cons:
Competition wins because of lower prices - I feel like everyone is so worried about performing to impress corporate that pricing is usually the reason we lose business, not because of quality of service
We have no say in the software selected... no questions or surveys at the field level. "We're implementing this"...Period. 
I'd like to work with people of a different gender once in a while.

pros:
IT was a very simple, easy job
Gives you immediate hiring for the most part
Can have a flexible schedule
cons:
Its a periodical job mostly doing warehouse work
No job stability. If the time of the year is slow you will be looking for employment elsewhere
If your unable to work on days they ask you they won't  follow up with you for new jobs. In my situation I couldn't work a certain day and they became extremly upset. They told me there was no work available. Next thing you know I met up with a buddy of mine from the job and he said they had been hiring new people for the past month. Unknowingly I assumed there was no work for 2 months.

pros: Application was quick and easy.  Talking on the phone with local representative was a joy.  I got a call back later for additional employment opportunities for which I seemed compatible.  They direct deposit pay checks, but you do not get a pay stub.  You can text to find out your pay info.
cons: It was quite confusing really nailing down the job I wanted.  I ended up getting put in as a "backup" at first, which was disappointing, but I eventually was able to work 15 days straight.  There is a quite a lot of paperwork to complete when you pick up a job (but I guess that's the case anywhere); pretty quick to complete, however, if done on a home computer.

review_title: Among the Best Employment Agencies There Are!
pros:
1. Wide variety of jobs available.
2. Many jobs available are temporary-to-permanent.
3. Hired within only weeks.
4. Friendly and helpful staff.
5. Application and onboarding process is easy, smooth and efficient.
cons: The after-hours Customer Service department does not fulfill payroll enquiries--especially in cases where you feel an error was made in your pay deposit.  This often results in having to wait as many as 3 days to get an answer, causing increased stress to employees.

review_title: A good learning experience, however it is not a place I would choose to continue a long term career.
pros: Decent starting wages,  Well known company, opportunity to work with big name companies, opportunity to learn more about the recruiting field.
cons: Management does not listen to the concerns of their employees, management can act very unprofessional in regards to situations with employees, awards/raises/promotions seem to be given based on favoritism more than merit.

pros: Nothing positive about this company
cons:
1)After joining and deployed to client location,They ll forget you..they wont pay your salary until you ask.
2)No mail response,Provide number which they wont lift.
3) They delay salary and if you ask them why if you are lucky if they lift your call..They come up with HR is on leave or Internal issue.
4)They wont reply to your mails even if you compose saying bad things about the company.So in general they know and they are accepting it
5)There is no future 
6)People inside Adecco are lazy and neglect things easily,it's like some govt people mentality if ask anything they easily get offended.
7)They dont even know the salary credit date.Adecco manager told me 1st of every month, HR told me 5th and salary process guy told me 7th.but i get my salary every month after 8th.Recently i received it on 12th.Its their wish actually

review_title: Great , but there are a few cons
pros: The company itself pays attention to its staff in regards to training and development which is extremely important in any position. They have quite a few incentives and uncapped commission. There's top talent trips for top performers within the company and monthly conferences so you can review your progress over the months.
cons: Micro management, very cut throat (Which is expected as it is a sales based position). The company could spend some money on a refurbishment. Sometimes you can feel like the management team are never satisfied.

pros:
easy 500 a week
flexible schedule
cons:
You should know, that technically it is not FULL time because you are required to take 30 min lunch break every day without pay. So that is 37.5 hours a week

You should also know you are being micromanaged. Every move you make on the computer and the floor is being watched by "management" You are sitting at a desk for 7.5 hours. If you're not at your desk and you want to go to the bathroom or get water or for a 15 min break you are to punch in a code for that on the phone on your desk.

Everything is being looked at by this boss lady from Canada who visits once or twice a month. 

There is a lot of favoritism by the team leads. They just want someone who is quite and puts in their numbers. They are using you.

review_title: Underpays top talent and makes promises it doesn't keep
pros: It is a large, growing company so there are many internal opportunities.
cons: Underpays top talent and makes promises of increases but never follows through. Pays outside talent more then talent that has been with the company for years and therefore proven their talent. Notoriously bad management - micro managers, bad comm skills, not supportive, confusing, etc. Appears to make some ppl managers just bc they have been with the company for a while, not bc they have the talent to be a manager.

review_title: General Labor, in a recessive economy
pros: Lots of assignments and weekly pay.
cons: Low wages, lots of assignments that only an illegal would accept,  They, in my opinion, never lived up to there mission statement. "Matching your job preferences and skill level with our clients' needs" (quote from their employee handbook).  I found the statement to be less than withstanding.

review_title: Huge disconnect between assignment and employer
job_title: Senior Ops Specialist in San Francisco, CA
pros: To be honest, I do not think I have anything positive to say about this company. Ultimately, if you chose to accept employment as a contractor you ave to understand what you are actually signing up for.
cons: There was a lack of transparency and honesty when it came to assignment.  I even had to fight them to receive an official offer letter.  Contract work is not career work, so  make sure you have a plan and reason for deciding to work as a temp.

pros: Getting paid every week, being able to work in various fields depending on experience, the friendships one makes from assignments, gaining transferable skills, and establishing references as well as networks.
cons: The staff doesn't check up on you occasionally to make sure one is still looking for an assignment or if one might be of interest. They especially do not check in with you to see how Ann assignment is going and how their clients are treating their associates. One might have to remind them or play phone tag with staff.

pros: Everyone in the region is extremely welcoming and helpful. Adecco provides training and endless resources to help you. There is a lot of support within the branch, so if you do happen to miss a day or two there are other recruiters in the office to help back you up. There is good communication between recruiters and upper management (branch managers, sales, operations, rvp, vps). Overall I have been very happy and satisfied working here.
cons: This isn't a huge con/negative but not only are we recruiters but we are counselors, payrollers, trainers, therapists, etc. We deal with different people, different issues, different things every day & we should have a bit of a higher salary to show for it.

job_title: Field Support Engineer in Bucharest, Bucuresti
pros:
- good companies to work at, as a leased employee
- getting exposed to good work ethic principles, if at the right company 
- 23 days of paid leave (instead of the standard 21 days)
cons:
- logistically overstretched team = very few people and a high work volume
- being a leased employee, there is little room for pay raises or any other benefits
- you are treated as a number, not as a human being

pros: Bonus opportunities, offices around the world, opportunity to help people who are starting over.
cons: Long hours, lack of management support, high stress, no time off, zero recognition.

pros: Company had a good relationship with the client and I had steady work for years.  They also had an educational assistance program I used.  It wasn't much, but every little bit helped.
cons: They did not offer any insurance benefits.  There was no real career path, and no real way to get increases based on merit or longevity.  Sometimes the recruiters and branch manager were a bit arrogant and came across like recruiting was too much bother for them and the client was too difficult to work with.

review_title: Very Pleased With Adecco Greensboro NC Facility
pros: Excellent recruiter / rep to work with in the Greensboro NC facility, friendly, professional, easy to reach, always available to answer questions or provide assistance.
cons: Sadly, contract labor doesn't matter to the company Adecco places you with as they can find ten more in one day, unfortunately the assigned company (Volvo Trucks) doesn't realize that contractors also value and take their jobs quite seriously. Also, Adecco offered health insurance plan could have been much better.

pros: I was a former employee with the IT department over 10 years.  It was a good company when I first started, worked with some nice people along the way.
cons: But then later on Adecco outsourced different areas of IT to India and I was let go.  Along with many others.  On top of that they relocated the Corporate Headquarters to Jacksonville, Florida.  So then people in the business areas were also being laid off.  Then the building was sold and Adecco leased back a smaller space from the new owner.  But they continue to hire new people unaware of what transpired.  So everyone waits to hear what is being announced at the quarterly town hall meetings if any departments will be relocated or the Melville office will close permanently.  So if you are considering a position in the Melville location beware.

pros: No company is perfect but Adecco really does want to be as close as possible. The company has exceptional leaders at the very top.
cons: The compensation at the lower level isn't as competitive as it should be and there is a lot of "personal time" that needs to be given to the job.

review_title: Challenging environment unless you are a "yes" person
pros: Connected to the largest recruitment firm globally.  Recognized brand. Difficult to say anything else here really as these are the only Pros that I can come up with.
cons: You must be willing to do as you are told and answer YES to every request.  Management - both Mid and Senior - have really no say or power as everything comes down to what the Canadian President decides.  Mid and Senior management just do as directed by the Canadian President and do not have any influence.

pros: The pay is the only pro oh and it’s not hard to get hired
cons: I only have 3hrs plus weekends to myself, they keep hiring knowing majority of us will be laid off in 2 months. Prepare to spend your entire life at Honda barely any days off and if you use them it effects your ability to get hired. You have to use emergency days for appointments made in advanced it’s just horrible

review_title: They help get you in the door.
pros: As I just said, the temp jobs help you get in front of people working for companies you ordinarily have no interactions with.  The staff at Adecco are very supportive and friendly.  They do their best to give you as much info as possible before starting at a company and advocating for you if you deserve higher pay.  There is health insurance available but it's minimal.
cons: The insurance benefits are like the Diet Coke of benefits.  They don't cover anything really.  The staff also needs to make sure that when employees are eligible for benefits, that they let them know.

review_title: Amazing leadership and group of colleagues!
pros: I work internally for Adecco and have been for many years. To this day, it impresses me how it feels like a family for being such a large company. Our senior leadership team is impressive and colleagues take pride in what they do.
cons: There aren't any really from my point of view. I think that if I were to be picky, I would say that we could increase communication so colleagues of all levels are aware of the initiatives of the company and get more involved.

pros: So far they've been able to get me out on assignments but nothing on a temp to hire which is what I'm looking for.  I think they like to test you a bit before they will trust you to a full time position.
cons: Don't know where you are going to work from week to week or sometimes day to day.  No guaranteed hours although I'm think it's the same with ant temp agency.

pros: Timely in their correspondence, clear on expectations and assignments, robust portal for pay information, pay stubs, benefits, etc. Easy to use online time entry. Weekly rather than bi-weekly paychecks.
cons: All employment as a temp or contractor is of course temporary, meaning there is limited job security. That being said, there is no de-facto limit to  the length of assignments. If you do a good job, you create your own job security.

review_title: Not a company that will help you grow within a career
job_title: Human Resources Specialist/Accounts Payable Specialist in Lithonia, GA
pros: They work quickly at placing you on an assignment
cons: They place you in assignments and leave you there regardless if you are no longer happy at the company they placed you.  Its like they place you and forget about you.  Also it is very depressing to work for a company for years with no benefits;  No sick pay, no vacation or holiday and everything starts back over yearly.  So if you have been employed with Adecco for five years, once January comes, if you do not have enough hours accrued, you will not get payed holiday pay until you once again accrue enough hours.

pros: Corporate resources, training, fun fast paced type of job that promotes competition.
cons: A company this large can inadvertently obstruct the recruitment process because it lacks agility.  While it was beneficial to learn and work with a large client pool, the recruiting assignments can suffer from a 'transactional' effect that rewards expedience over quality.

pros: 3 week's of PTO to start with.
cons: There is not balance between your personal life and work. Expected to be available 24x7. In the office I worked for required a lot of work outside of normal business hours that you were not compensated for. They do not believe in half days.. if you wanted to only work 4 hours of a day you were required to use a full 8 hour day of PTO. Liked to think they had an open door policy; however whenever issues/concerns were brought to their attention nothing was taken serious.

review_title: My experience could have been improved.
job_title: Client Relationship Consultant in Alpharetta, GA
pros: Your day will go by very quickly and you may actually enjoy the work. There are some great opportunities for growth, and the people on your team will become very close. My experience would have been better if I didn't have the same manager.
cons: Management can depress morale in about five minutes. I would still be working there if I had a different manager, and honestly, could have been switched to a different team, but was so fed up with the way I was treated that I wanted nothing more to do with the company.

pros: Great opportunity for advancing your career. ONLY ADVANCING YOUR CAREER IN THE LONG TERM RUN. 9-15 months. Look for other options of employment because you will be screwed over. SKIP ADECCO AND GO STRAIGHT TO THE COMAPNY THEY ARE HIRING FOR.
cons: TERRIBLE benefits and POOR management. This company will make what should be normal benefits extremely hard to obtain. Everything they do is taking advantage of you.  especially pay! I was informed I was being paid 15 dollars an hour less than what I could be paid for 15 months. Adecco retained what I should have been paid and there is no renegotiating. Recruiters will  only tell you a small portion of the truth to get you working.

review_title: Better Work, Better Life (Adecco's logo).....Can you say...IRONY!!!
pros:
Melville office was conveniently located for L.I. residents
I've worked at Adecco for over ten years....atmosphere/people are very friendly and helpful.
Vacation is nice...18 days to start, 23 days after 5 years, 28 after ten.
cons:
Very unorganized and chaotic organization structure.
Melville office is closing on Dec 31, 2014
The company wants to run like google and apple, without spending money on it's IT budget.  
There's no career path, HR is non-existent.
Decisions are made out of it's global HQ, with little understanding how a US Market operates.

review_title: Over the last 20+ years I have gained excellent recruiting,sales,customer service and administrative skills.i
job_title: SST Recruiter-Ramp Team in Rochester, NY
pros: At Adecco, you learn a great deal about the work that is being offered all around the USA not just Rochester NY.  You have the ability to move up and contribute to a great company.
cons: I guess the only down side to Adecco is that our well working facility had to be closed down after alot of great talent was hired.  Adecco is still very strong though and putting good people  to work.

review_title: Nice staffing service to work for
pros: I had several health issues that kept me from being able to work at times. The women that handle job placement at Adecco where always happy to help me find another job or would make arrangements to keep me at the job I was working.  If I were able to continue working I would still be working through them.
cons: My first check was 2cdats late due to an error inputting my information on the pay cards that they use.

pros: Flexible and  the best reason to work for a Adecco is the reliable connection to the work you need and want. The staffing industry is almost always hiring.
cons: May not be a good option for someone looking for steady employment.  Assignments can range from a few hours to a few years. After several assignments, you’ll have a much better idea of the kind of corporate culture, management, and projects you most enjoy.

pros: Good way to gain experience, meet some nice people.  If you don't need healthcare benefits and can still get them from your parents or if you can get them from your spouse temporary jobs are the way to go.
cons: Unless assignment is a direct hire, the jobs are probably always temporary (even if they tell you there is an opportunity to be hired permanent). Some people are very competitive to try to get hired permanent (like smile to your face but stab you in your back).

review_title: Fast-paced environment with a bright future
pros:
- Global leader in the staffing industry
- Investments made in the right places
- Strong value-based culture
- Good mix of long-term employees and "fresh blood"
- Good performance leads to career opportunities
- Salaries and benefits are competitive
cons:
- Investments in some areas of the company not sufficient, even though resources would be available
- Innovation is sometimes stopped because of short-term vision or simply no vision at all
- Rising complexity of the business requires more and more smart people that understand to deal with this, which would require some changes on decision-maker levels; but this process is very slow

pros: Team is awesome to work with. I enjoy coming into work every day. Flexible hours. Downtown London. Little pressure to produce.
cons:
Company is mostly concerned with keeping costs as low as possible, if that means reducing hours, not providing proper training, etc. 
Big disconnect between divisions in the branch. Management is complacent on major issues. No money to support social committee & events. High turnover.

pros:
Flexible Schedule
Time to learn new things
cons:
Absent Management - A lot of managers don't interact with their teams. They stay tucked away and ignore their teams who have to govern themselves.

Favoritism - More often than not good people leave because they are passed up for promotions for people who aren't as qualified but played politics.

Pay - Grossly underpays employees. Personally leaving as I'm paid $20k under average value for my position.

Benefits - Very expensive and not that good.

Turnover- High turnover rate. Mainly do to the favoritism and pay.

pros: The Pay is competitive, with excellent work hours and the training is complete and useful.  The Representative  helped set the standard to which work will be judged by the inspectors at the production lines.   They willing and able to help you find a good fit for your qualification and talents.
cons: Communication with them can take some time so being patient is key.  Every once is a while you end up waiting to find someone to talk concerning an issue encounter.

pros: You get happiness and relaxation for a short period of time thinking that finally you are employed. 🤗
cons: They lure you with lies, and false promises so you can work for them. I PROMISE  it's going to be a long term job!  And they asked specifically for you to come back to work! B'S they did it to me twice. Very unprofessional and unreliable. If you want to work only for a few days, maybe a week, this is the place for you to apply. If you want to work for a long period, don't even trust them!

review_title: Great place to work but you are on your own.
job_title: Direct Hire Recruiter in San Jose, CA
pros: You get to work for the #1 Staffing Agency in the world.  There is definitely a lot more freedom to do what you want to do as long as your making placements.
cons: There is no database of candidates, they won't spend money on any resources to help recruiters.  They are limiting any spending period (whether its taking candidates or clients to lunch).  There is no help from management and we compete against companies that we own (Ajilon).

review_title: Adecco is innovative and socially conscious and truly cares about its candidates, clients and employees.
pros: From my experience, Adecco's internal staff is generally very bright. The company is very innovative and involved in charitable events and keeps staff informed of the company's performance and goals moving forward. Upper management does a very good job of communicating to the branches.
cons: As with any large company, there can be quite a bit of bureacracy to get something accomplished, and that can be frustrating. There are some departments that seem territorial and tend to forget that we're all in this together and working for a common goal, but that's also true of most companies in my experience.

pros: None. Very disappointed in this company.
cons: None. Terrible people. Not even close to doing a good job

pros: Benefits, including tuition reimbursement and management listens. Flextime is an option, casual Fridays, half days on Fridays in the summer and 3 floating holidays are just a few more benefits offered. More benefits include: Free online courses, 100% 401K matching and employee discount programs for pet insurance, legal counsel and cellphone plans to name a few.
cons: None; all concerns are addressed and anyone who has excellent attendance and a good work ethic will do well.

review_title: Very ethical, well run company...each office has its own personality
pros: Internal staff are paid well, often promoted, great benefits, including a lot of PTO.  Offices are global, and the industry is more or less recession proof.  Recruiters and account reps within Adecco are given solid training and a well-known brand to work with.
cons: Each office has its own leadership, which can vary greatly in culture, expectations, and turn around.  Some offices are very happy, given a great deal of autonomy, and help develop their employees.  While other offices have constant turnover and authoritarian-type management--you won't know that until you get in!

pros: Leadership Development, Autonomy, Fantastic Culture, Plethora of tools available for you, Employer Branding, Social Corporate Responsibility, Benefits Package is AMAZING
cons: Unrealistic Sales Expectations in 2018, Sharing rooms with other managers while traveling, Over 30 passwords to keep track of for multiple websites and tools, Pay and bonus structure not in line with competitors, long hours

review_title: Appalling, the management change the commission scheme  on themselves and  not discuss with the employee
pros: Big company, have many clients, big data base.  Have a lot of support on business development, client referral.
cons: It is like working in a people factory.

review_title: A Good Stepping Stone for Advancing Your Career
pros: Availablity of resources--due to the size of the company there are more resources than normal. Training is always available at the corporate office and there are many opportunities for networking with other Adecco branches.
cons: On the flip side, sometimes it is a detriment working for a large company. Lots of red tape if you want to do something different, something that may work better, but not necessarily as it is written in the "manual".

job_title: Client Program Supervisor in Melville, NY
pros: The only reson to work at Adecco is experience on your resume if you are thinking of a career in HR. Adecco is merely a stepping stone that is about the only thing good about this company if you can hang in there for long
cons: You don't feel appreciated by upper management, promotions aren't given by seniority or experience and knowledge internally but if you are a job seeker externally with Adecco and know the Regional Vice President or someone in upper management you will be sure to get the job over a colleague that has great experience and always has great performance reviews and is fully capable of doing the job extremely well

pros: This has been a great learning experiencing for me and given me the chance to immerse myself in many different roles.  This position will definitely never be boring, there is something new going on every day.   You get the opportunity to meet and work with many different people from many different walks of life.
cons: One of the downsides to this position is that our pay rate really does not fit all of the work that this position requires.  We are constantly taking on new roles and new challenges with this job, but the work is really not rewarded financially.

pros: Close to home. Could walk. There werent too many pro's to mention. Most of the resourcing I did as recruiter was done surfing the internet.
cons:
Had to resource talent through free internet websites. High expectations to set the recruiter to fail.  Given me the impression I can make a difference by managing the work but then over ruled - its like having the rug pulled from under you before being thrown under the bus.

Supervisor does not care about her jr recruiters and only cares for herself. Thinks she has a sense of entitlement being in her position for less than a year as a senior.

High turn over

Pay is below standard

No growth potential unless you want to permanently stay as  a recruiter

job_title: Customer Service Representative in Beaverton, OR
pros: Usually you'll have a job in a matter of days, up to a couple weeks.  This is fantastic if you're moving to a new place, or are desperate.
cons:
Adecco takes a steep fee from your hourly pay, will place you with the first available job instead of those best suited to your skills, never returns phone calls, and generally has some of the worst customer service I've ever experienced.

You also usually have to physically go to their specific office before you can be placed, even if you have an Adecco office near you that can perform drug tests and the like, which makes it extremely hard to line up a job if you're moving to a new state.

review_title: Employee appreciation and recognition is not at the top of Adecco's list.
job_title: Administrative Assistant in Research Triangle Park, NC
pros: This is my third assignment with Adecco, as I am in NC now.  When I made my initial call to Adecco, they were very interested and excited to help me find work.  Also, while working in NJ several years ago with Adecco they were very interested in me finding the best employer to suit my experiences and character and worked hard to offer those types of assignments to be without hesitation.  In fact, there were two offices who were almost fighting over me working for them.  One thing I can say about Adecco is that they will try hard to find an assignment for you.
cons: While working in NJ with Adecco, I was one of the most sought after Admins.  But even though I was sought after, I was not given any type of bonus, recognition or an increase in pay for my hard work from anyone within any of the Adecco staffing offices.  Working with the staff in the Adecco office was always a pleasure and they did their best to make sure I was compensated for the assignments that lasted longer than anticipated, but I was never given any type of recognition for my hard work and for going beyond the call of duty with working extra long hours and my encounter with Managers who were extremely hard to work for and who no one else wanted to work for. Also, no vacation pay was given, but only small bonus after you worked a total of 1800 hours which was calculated and and based on only a regular 40 hour week and not the entire hours that were worked within any given week.  If you did not work a total of 1800 (regular hours within a given year) you did not get any type of bonus and the cycle would start all over at the beginning of each year.  To me this is obvioiusly slave work for Adecco employees, as we don't get any type of vacation pay at all.  When working with other agencies, i.e., Randstadt, Kelly Services, etc. they do offering some type of vacation pay to their employees.  Also, Adecco's medical insurance plan is a total joke and should be revamped without hesitation.  The insurance plan only allows you to receive $250.00 worth of medical coverage and then everything else is out of pocket.

review_title: You have to make it work for you
pros: Great technology. Provides you the opportunity to meet very interesting people.
cons: Hierarchy is so highly regarded, it is clear those at entry level positions are not given a voice.  Some time the folks working the front lines have the best solutions.

pros: Adecco is a large brand and is well known, it is a reputable company that has made large aquisitions recently thus meaning scope and breadth for opportunity.
cons: The size and scale of the business can sometimes make it feel a little too much as though you are a cog in a machine and not an integral part of the team and the vision of the business.

review_title: A good place to discover whether you could be a successful recruiter or not
pros:
Great dynamics - many clients, various industries, positions at different levels
Fair and satisfying bonus scheme - you know what you are putting efforts for
Friendly and informal work environment, enough freedom
A lot of space for creativity and realization of own ideas
Great people
cons:
There is a tendency of letting the talented new-comers cope with the new environment by their own - not good initial training, expectations for fast results during the first months
Very emotionally engaging and stressful job, handling many projects at the same time, always tough deadlines

review_title: Working as a temp for Adecco
pros: Adecco seemed to have the best contacts for larger organisations; they worked to find me a job based on my skillset & made several offers, easy to get hold of.
cons: Sometimes the staff in the office were a little abrupt when dealing with you even though you had a genuine enquiry, not much contact after role was started to find out how you were doing.

review_title: Temp Agency posing as a technical recruiter.
pros: This company is probably OK for warehouse workers or administrators. They seem geared to support that kind of position.
cons: This company was not suitable as a high-tech recruiter. They do not offer the support, institutional knowledge and expertise needed to hire highly qualified professionals. Their benefits are non-existent and their recruiters told me a few things about 401(k), vacation time, and other perks that turned out to be false. I don't blame them. They were clearly not trained for the position. Additionally, one week I did not receive a paycheck and the regional manager got defensive and hostile when I complained about it.

job_title: Human Resources Service Centre Manager in Birmingham, England
pros:
People are proud and motivated to work here. A great working environment offering mutual support, promotes trust, rewards employees’ efforts, and ensures that employees know their work is meaningful.  

A focus on developing their employees as people are continually encouraged to grow and learn new skills.  A company that expects you to rise to the challenge and be completely engaged.  

The company offers excellent benefits in return for the skills, capabilities and experience they bring to the Group.

If you get the opportunity to work for the Adecco Group, take it!
cons: None at this point so far.

pros: I worked as an incoming call csr for radial when it was still ebay and then after it became radial.  There was mandatory overtime and involuntary undertime.  Huge lack of supervisor support and poor company policy for the vertical i was assigned to.
cons: Poor supervisor support. Terrible handling of customer orders by the company which in turn came down on you since you were the one taking the calls from the customers.

pros: They did find me a good job.  The paycheck was never late.  They did pay for six holidays per year.
cons: The optional and expensive medical policy was not worth having.  There was virtually no contact from my recruiter once I was placed, even when I tried to reach that person about important matters. Voice mail message and emails remained un-responded to.  There was no attempt at negotiating cost of living increases or performance increases for very long term placements.

pros: Excellent company to work for as a colleague. Please note that I am not an associate or temporary employee. The best staffing company to work for. We treat our temporary employees well. Huge focus on development and succession planning. Definitely a great place to work.
cons: Chaotic and stressful job. There is a lot of pressure and you have to learn that your temps will always let you down. Management is awesome, when your clients and employees frustrate or let you down your managers and colleagues are there for you.

pros: You dnt have to stand all day you meet great ppl and a few of the supervisors were amazing people. You also meet amazing co workers.
cons: Pay was weekly. You dnt get paid much. Some supervisors always give you a hard time. Customers  belittle you and curse at you on the phones. They have a number of hours you can call out which is 3 days every three months they watch your time even bathroom breaks and you can be a min over.  They cancel breaks if call volume is high. When call volume is low they send you home so you’re not garaunteed hours.

pros: Learned multiple systems used by customers (3rd party software). Work from home some days.  Benefits of working within a team as well as working solo on various projects.

review_title: Do NOT recruit for this company.
pros: I loved my job when I first started and I loved my branch manager. It was a really great place to work and I was motivated to go after promotions. My efforts were 100% recognized and rewarded.
cons: Once the divisional leadership changed in 2014, the company moral and ethics changed with it. Our schedules were changed so we would sometimes work evenings or weekend hours, but always overtime - without the additional pay because we were exempt salary. Every time a recruiter left, they never replaced them so the workload was piled on top of the remaining recruiters. We were drowning in administrative work but scolded for not filling orders and having enough appointments scheduled. I worked from home every single night so that my orders wouldn't get escalated to divisional leadership. It got so bad that I alone was handling over 100+ orders at one time and had no work-life balance. The company goals for recruiters did not coincide with our clients' expectations.  Our associate payroll always screwed up as well - constant issues with our associates getting paid. We'd direct them to call payroll but when they did, they'd get 5 different answers so we'd always be the ones wasting our time solving payroll issues because they couldn't get it together rather than doing our job and filling our orders. PTO was great! But when you took it, you'd have to work OT when you got back because nobody was able to watch your accounts so it was pointless to take it and all you did was put out fires for the next month.

review_title: Not great environment to work in this company
pros: I worked with this company around 2.5 Yrs as full time employee. Company and company policies are good
cons: Company process is very poor in terms of employee engagement, Increments, Incentives and certain bonuses. They treat employees as no value and they value for the company making money. They not look the employee efforts and dedication what they put to make thier business go smooth as thier client needed.

pros: Opportunity create your own future;
cons:
pay, commission, bonuses and benefits are  not competitive for the area or industry;
position is broken up into territories, you can't reap the benefits of making a sale in your territory that grows out of your territory; this position consists of operations and biz development=its unrealistic; there is alot of red tape at Adecco and its hard to get candidates pushed through the process as well as getting prospects settled in as clients; most of the training is done on modules;

pros: This was a very interesting job, and I learned in depth knowledge about my position. The training was superb!
cons: No paid time off no matter how long you've worked there! Unless you're ranked in the top ten of your class, expect to get the least favorable schedule! Attendence policy is based on points. If you're five minutes late, -.25 for every five minutes you're late!I If you are sick, -1 for each day you are out! Death in the family, - 1 per day. Once you hit 8 points, you're fired! Also the call center is 25 miles from Denver! Subpar pay and no affordable health or other benefits!

pros: Great pay, opportunity for overtime and supposedly full time interview after two years depending on whether you are a full time associate.
cons: Injured on the job associates, although given the opportunity to do a non physical job for a time while healing (getting surgery or physical therapy), are let go and have to rehire if not healed in a short amount of time or find work elsewhere. I've seen many associates work through Adecco without getting an opportunity to go full time in two years as promised.

review_title: Contract work provides skilled labor at the expense of the contractor

pros: Cannot think of a single positive thing about Adecco

You will be constantly chasing up owed wages.
Accrued holiday pay is a nightmare to obtain too.

My advice to you is to take photos of your clock cards and create a spreadsheet of all the hours you have worked, how much you earned, and how many hours Adecco have credited you for working - it will always be wrong (at one point I was over £500 behind with owed wages)

these people deserve to be sued for their treatment of employees that they have they need to have more benefits they need to have transportation reimbursements for people who are struggling to even get to jobs they deserve to be sued for everything.

pros:
-Adecco does a good job of providing a decent paid-time-off schedule (not GREAT but is good).
-Compared to some other agencies - they dont' "require" their salaried recruiters to put in 50 hours a week.
-It is a large company, so you could relocate easily if you needed to.
-Everyone in the organization has an overall good personality and are fun to work with.
cons:
-Many manager are promoted because of years in the organization and NOT necessarily performance.  So you have a good chance of working for someone who is completely unqualified.  When your commission is based on your manager's performance in the field with clients, taking a gamble isn't a good thing.  (Although some managers are GREAT at their job, and the employees that report to that manager have a much better work experience.)
-Commission structure could be changed to be MUCH more competitive.
-Processes change almost daily.  New leadership, new processes, new ways to document things.
-Upper management doesn't value employees, or credit them with being intelligent unless you've been with the company for 10+ years, despite your education or experience.  (see advice to management)

pros: Adecco USA is an international organization, but locally (i.e. Jacksonville, FL) it has the culture and environment of a family-owned business. job_title: Software Testing Engineer in Boise, ID
pros: They were a good company with good management and human resources.  Using Adecco is a great way of getting exposure to many different career fields (if that is what you want or request) and a great way to keep working in between career moves or other life changes.  Overall a very good company to work for.
cons: Benefits are non-existent to terrible for contractors.

pros: Pretty good office environment. At the beginning at least it feels like you're being brought onto the team. They provide a decent set of technology and tools to work with. Had one great coworker who had been there for years and was just a wonderful person to work with. I learned a heck of a lot just from being thrown to the wolves.
cons: 90% of the jobs I recruited for were completely unqualified. Spent weeks working to fill a mid-senior position only to have it finally downgraded to literally a temp office admin position, which was a total waste of time (this really hurts you when you're a recruiter, obviously). This sort of thing was the norm, not the exception. Corporate orders would come in for positions paying literally half of the going market rate. You can get people a little below market, but at half the market rate in this economy, it's just an impossible task. All training beyond first week basic "this is how our computer system works" was through computer modules. No in-depth personal training was provided at all, no mentoring, no professional development (I had asked about all of this before leaving my previous job for this one and was sold a bill of goods). We didn't have an account exec in our office so there were few opportunities to make placements. Made a couple big permanent placements that brought in substantial fees and then let go before commission had to be paid out on them (thanks guys!). They're being merged with/into Modis, and I would stay away until that whole thing shakes out because Modis obviously has the upper hand. They also claim they take a "consultative approach" and to be fair, it seemed that way at the beginning, but it the end it felt like a boiler room. The day before I was let go we were told explicitly to lie to candidates in order to pump them for information and nudge them into positions. I just don't believe that you have to do that to be successful as a recruiter or to be profitable as a branch, and it's a shame they're heading in that direction. I really liked the job itself and actually thought it was going fairly well when I got the ax, but overall I somewhat regret leaving my decent and stable job for what turned out to be a completely marginal opportunity.

review_title: Good people, for the most part
pros: Lots of feel good celebrations.  The LA RVP as of two years ago, is one of the best leaders.  Coworkers bend over backwards to help each other. Once you figure out the system, you can get most things done quickly.
cons: Structure changes can leave offices and onsite locations on an island.  Some leader will always say yes to the client even at the expense of their workers.

pros: 5 days working, Salaries on time, Incentives are on time and good reporting managers. This company is okay for freshers and who want to start their careers, not recommended for experienced candidates.

review_title: Highly recommended...if you want to work, Adecco will work hard to find a job for you!
pros:
I highly recommend this temporary agency if you are looking for work. They will put your foot in the right doors in the Portland, Oregon, USA metro area. 

I have worked with directly with several Adecco recruiters and their manager since 2012. Amazing friendly recruiting staff who pay attention to their skills inventory. They try to find a fit and put you to work whether it's an expert position or your first entry-level job. Recruiters will call you quickly when you apply or they spot an opening. This agency works harder than most agencies to ensure you have a shot at a job. 

This company gives everyone who wants to work a chance. Many employees of Adecco have told me their stories of how they searched a long time for work or lacked experience until they came to Adecco. It’s a great place for college graduates or those switching careers to build on-the-job experience. 

I worked with onsite Adecco supervisors for a big company since 2012.  At this company I observed Adecco supervisors hiring and managing 250 to 400 temporary workers weekly. The supervisors are very kind people who really care a great deal about your happiness and fit within the temporary assignment. Supervisors are fair and reasonable when it comes to discipline. Supervisors will be your advocate to solve problems proactively if you need them. 

Adecco always pays on time and sets up direct deposit quickly.
cons:
Sometimes it's hard to tell what job you are applying for because they don't always e-mail job descriptions and prefer to tell you over the phone. 

Salaries offered can be low; don't be afraid to negotiate for more. 

The holiday pay is hard to get until you work 6 months non-stop because every holiday taken unpaid counts against you. The same problem applies to the service bonus to help you pay for your own vacation and sick pay; you must work 10 months with only 1 or 2 days off to achieve that bonus. 

Benefits do cost money, and medical insurance is no longer offered so be aware of that problem going in. They do offer a preventative plan; however that plan is not going to pay a cent if any illness is found.

pros: Good work life balance. There is flexibility if you need it. If you are happy in your position and not looking for advancement, this is the company for you.
cons: Pay lower than competitors. And part of that is that they don't want to promote people because then they will have to give them more money.

job_title: Google Shopping Express Store Operator in Mountain View, CA
pros: The only pro with this company is that they had the recruiting contract with Google Shopping Express.
cons: The management has no idea how to treat employees.  They treated us like unpaid slaves rather than paid workers.  We were required to check our email 24/7 for schedule updates on a near minimum wage jobs.

pros: Guaranteed and accessible employment to people who are impatient with the entry level job market. If you get let go from one work location, they will usually set you up with another.
cons: Temporary workers are often mistreated by full timers in work locations. A lack of patience to some extent for training temp workers. A lot of drama and backstabbing in factory settings.

pros:
Adecco is such a large corporation with extensive connections and close relationships to various companies in different industries.  Working with an international company has been challenging but extremely rewarding.  I have learned so much at my time as a developer at Adecco. The team is beyond passionate about and dedicated to the projects but also extremely talented.  

The work ethic and culture is great; fantastic benefits, lots of perks and events, marathons, charity events, office games, celebrations for worldwide events to celebrate our company and clientele. The team is so intelligent and I have learned so much -- Adecco provides every means necessary to progress your career, from courses to daily questions there is always a way to learn if you want to learn and always someone to turn to with a question, or for advice.

The team and colleagues as well as the contractors who are working on the projects are anything but lazy, they are dedicated, passionate, talented, progressive -- they are truly making the future happen.
cons: Although there have been rough times, management has handled it in the most professional way imaginable; any changes that occur they make sure each employee is informed and taken care of. The one issue I had initially was the lack of an on-boarding system and some lack of organization during changing times in the company, but that soon diminished due to helpful and smart co-workers and a plethora of options available to learn more or further your career with educational classes or projects.
