review_title: Extremely positive, I love this company and people here
pros:
A fantastic company, a great place towork, where people matter and everything is organized to improve employees motivation/ engagement. 
Very nice People, career possibilities, training, environment, leader in the world, engaging, passion, continuous improvement, management are coming from the branches, so they know the business and what the team care
cons: It's a network of over 6000 branches, everyone relatively small, sometime you may feel in a small organization if you do not have a strong entrepreneurship spirit.

pros: Adecco is a great place to work to gain experience and help people find jobs.
cons: Management makes or breaks a branch and/or region.  Absent RVP's and unrealistic expectations from management create high turnover and lose very skilled colleagues.  Colleagues often become frustrated with the bonus structure, the structure is not indicative of the hard work of staff.  Most people come to Adecco gain amazing work experience and then leave for higher salaried roles or recruiting roles with better commission.

review_title: Interview your recruiter closely before accepting a position.
pros:
-Friendly office staff
-I did get to work quickly
-The online benefits and time sheet entry system are convenient.
-No micromanagement
-The Skillsoft online course training is vast and convenient
cons:
-They offer no benefits to contract staff (no personal leave, no sick days, no vacation)
-No bonus eligibility (unless Adecco decides to offer one).  If the client you work for offers a company bonus to their employees- you're out-of-luck.
-Very little communication from HR or others.  There are no emails to tell you what day Adecco will pay your check when it lands on a holiday, which could be a long weekend.
-Probably one of the worst experiences is trying to contact a LIVE person at payroll and benefits to speak with.  I have held avg. of at least 15-20 minutes, and then hang-up.  However, I have been left on-hold for 1 hour in the automated queue.  No one ever picked up.  (It should not matter the time of year an employee calls-in, there should be someone to talk with during business hours, during the week.
-There seems very little concern for their contractor staff.  In their policies and little concern shown to their contractors when contacted- you feel as if you have very little value to them.  You are expendable. They like the time you send-in your timesheet because then Adecco can bill the client and get paid. 
-Finally- realize that their policy of "Paid-holiday" is structured by design where I would bet very few reach their requirements to qualify.  And, they state they reserve the right to change or retract that said "Paid-holiday" at any time.  Here's why that matters--  A contractor with Adecco receives no opportunity to accrue "personal leave, sick pay, or vacation pay." They do not pay if the client you are serving pays holiday pay to their staff. Keep in mind- most clients will close the building on a holiday.  So- that leaves the contractor losing a day(s) of pay.  The only way to make a full-week of pay is to find some off-hour time the client will allow you make it up.  So- as a contractor for Adecco-  you are royally screwed with their policies.  

I have made attempts to contact the corporate office to address this concern to me, but they don't seem to care.  That's what you are dealing with when working with Adecco. 

I'll say it depends on your goals.  If you are a college student, or something looking to make some quick cash without benefits...its great.  If you think your client will hire you on full-time after a tour with Adecco...that's great!  However, if you need benefits, and would like to have a paid holiday now and or need to use paid personal leave- you won't have that option with Adecco's current policy structure.

I was told to cold call people to get them into interviews with minimal knowledge/ no script, so I made up my own so I didn't make the company look bad for my inexperience and lack of knowledge

pros: I had a really nice team. Unfortunately, I do not have much else to say because the cons outweigh the pros.

Micromanagement, gossip, and low pay lead to high levels of attrition. Turbulent operational strategies lack basic direction and vision for long-term consequences.

review_title: Run, don't walk away from Adecco
pros: Excellent benefit package, although the last few years the prices have skyrocketed.  I assume that is the same everywhere with the ACA.
cons: You are a number, a producer.  You are only as good as what you can do for the company.  They have had massive layoffs over the years and run on a skeleton crew in each branch.  Many times there is no time for a lunch break, or even sometimes a restroom break.  The processes and procedures are extremely intricate and difficult considering the production atmosphere you work in.

pros: nice team of dedicated workers who are willing to help people
cons: The Management doesn't support their own employees. They have the same approach for their own employees and for agency workers. Especially recruiters and HR administrators who are working so hard on local branches. They have to be on phone 24-7, also they had to do the overtimes on weekend and it wasn't paid at the end. Big stress doesn't worth the money the Adecco pays... so in one year all team where I used to work was gone (burned-out or fired) Maybe the situation on Adecco central branch where are finance people, intern HR etc is different. But this is my experience.

pros: Great colleagues to work with. It was like a family there.
cons: So many things are being or will be outsourced. That leaves behind a skeleton crew. Although most of the managers are sympathetic, the senior leaders will let you go without a thought, regardless of what you did for all of the previous years. People that held the place together in tough times were dismissed without a concern in the world.

review_title: Benefits are CRAP and Pay is on the low level
job_title: Part Qualified Accountant in London, England
pros: It does have a 9-5:30 culture
cons: IT systems are old... There are no benefits until you pass you probation period of 6 months. ie if you are sick you dont get paid. Also when you are studying for ACCA and they sponsor you the allowance for the study program is £1,000 a year and after you have passed all your exams and become qualified you have to stay at Adecco for a year or pay back study allowances!

review_title: Worth it if you put in the work
pros: Lots of connections to be made just by putting yourself out there. Both short and long assignments helped me network into a new position.
cons: Employees are stretched thin from long hours and can be irregular in their support . Sometimes they know far less about your supervisors and the position than you do after a quick phone call.

pros: You can obtain work fairly quickly, as in within about a month of application. Adecco also works with large employers, so in theory you could gain experience and a foot in the door toward a permanent job.  Key phrase: in theory.
cons: Pay is subpar particularly for the markets in which it operates and its partners. Adecco staff themselves seem to be really unhappy -- I have never seen an Adecco staffer smile. Benefits are cheap, meager; there is no flexibility in work schedules or time off which is supposed to be part of the point of being a contractor.

review_title: poor wages and no communication from 'handlers'
pros: The best reason would be if you could not get in anywhere else and needed money to eat.
cons: They are paid more than 30% of the of the pay your job site employer pays to get you to do the work. They don't return calls from you. They picked only ONE health insurance plan which was the worst one that met Affordable Care Act so you couldn't get Federal subsidy even you had low wages and would qualify. There was NO 401-K match. Some of these reviews are recruiters for Adecco who have better benefit packages but the contingents are treated like slaves.

pros: Assigned couple of workers that will help you while on assignment will respond to emails in a timely manner.
cons:
This is my review for working with Adecco on assignment at Google: first time doing contract position and so not sure if it's common, but they're old school. No electronic forms and they are very nit picky so you're going to have to do a lot of work on your own in terms of filling everything out and providing information. 

Use a lot of external tools that look so outdated.

pros: They act like nice people
cons: Everybody is nice and friendly. They offer what looks to be a great salary. However, when receiving my salary I found out that I was not paid the full amount. They told me this is because they only pay for the hours I have actually worked. Therefore, even though I worked fourthly hours a week, I would never get up to my full amount. This they will not tell you before signing. On top of that, they pay you weekly and you never actually receive a monthly paycheck. This means it is hard to actually figure this out. With me it happened by accident while doing my taxes. Please, please do not sign with Adecco.

review_title: One of extreme professional an personal growth.

None of which were for the betterment of the company. Employees were jumping ship almost as soon as they were brought on board. I should have left sooner than I did.

Adecco's policies are designed to pay the least amount holiday pay possible. Temps lose holiday pay if more than a week of unpaid time off is taken every six months. A horribly opportunistic situation, really, and a showcase of lax fair labor practices.

cons: Didn't have much success using them after I finished working at my 1st placement. The opportunities seemed limited for students mid way through their degree however this may have changed.

review_title: I produced results but was the wrong ethnicity to be accepted by upper management
pros: Adecco offers  the strength of name recognition and fantastic sales collateral. Benefits are ok and vast staffing knowledge is available to you.
cons: Branches are understaffed. No consistent design from one office to the next. No diversity in management. This is a company for European American females. If you are a minority, look elsewhere. Middle management  just wants yes people. They will use you up and scapegoat you to save their job.

pros: Global company, the opportunity to head overseas if that suits you. Continual turnover of staff at entry level is both good & bad.
cons: Regular strategic changes make it difficult to provide consistency to clients. Some of the focus is sometimes too heavily in favour of activity for activity's sake, instead of results and long-term client relationships.

review_title: An abundance of managers with but a shred of experience combined
pros: There was a good atmosphere amongst the team.
cons:
Managers were too competitive and political which resulted in confused metrics, goals and handballing of support issues. In particular, setting KPI targets that didn't reflect the aims of the work & showing a basic understanding of IT support.
The managers simply forgot to renew several contracts (they then panicked when replacing the staff).

pros: Easy to get a job. They'll take almost anyone. Pay is good depending on contract. Temp work hiring process is quick and easy.
cons: No benefits usually. Pay can be bad depending on contract. Reps from company who manager large numbers of contractors usually don't care and will take employers side.

review_title: RUN AND FIND A REAL CAREER
pros: The people I worked with were great for the most part. I liked the over time pay.
cons:
I worked at Honda and the management is horrible! No one listens to what you got to say! 
Benefits are terrible. Good luck trying to get off for a family members funeral.
Pay could be better since we do the same work if not more than the full-timers
Its a dead end job, unless you do some special favors for management your pretty much stuck where you get put. It's better to go and find a real career where you can make a difference and feel good about yourself.

pros: The staff was committed to my career goal and exercise excellent communication concerning contract opportunities with respect to my interests.
cons: The challenge exists of obtaining employment that leads to a permanent position and thus growing in a team environment where one develops relationships and appreciation for one's contribution to the work environment.

pros: Great opportunity to learn new things within recruiting and sales. Visit new places and great seminars for all recruiters.
cons: Management is a 50/50 where you will get a manager that knows what they are doing and encourage their team. Other side of the coin is management that don't know the specific business and have a very toxic way of treating their team. I knew several managers the fit the second scenario where their own team wanted nothing to do with their own managers.

job_title: Client Services Manager in Tam Kỳ
pros: They underway and expect colleagues to work 50 hour work weeks. Once mentioned that Saturday was veterans day and the response from senior leadership was ....thats not a real holiday.  They do not care about their people!
cons: Bullying atmosphere. No respect for PTO, upper management is run through croniasm and who you know. I was a top performer and given 0 support leadership.  No career development at all. Great place for women to work but no career opportunity for men!

review_title: Big company, little positive to talk about
pros:
Very well known brand name
Easy to open gates because of the above
Offices everywhere
Quite OK bonus system
cons:
Low quality searches
Mass reqruitment
Tarnished name in the business
Pay is very average
Put in same bracket as Manpower which does no good to the business

pros: Working with peers and pay
cons: Adecco is very political. You are the face of Google but the backing of unprofessional employer. I wonder if Google really knows what's going on. It sucks because it's a cool job but who actually back them... Smh also brothers sisters mothers cousin girlfriends work in the same store

pros: Was able to secure an assignment that I wanted.
cons: Communication after placement wasn't that great.  I had a hard time getting in touch with my supervisor at the agency (both email and telephone).

pros: Exciting, it was a total thrill to work for the company even though it was only for a short time, other staff were friendly and have become good friends with.
cons: You did have to have a lot of patience when working and it would sometimes be difficult but the majority of the time i would not say there were cons at all.

review_title: It is like being trapped in junior high school
job_title: Customer Service Representative in Tigard, OR
pros: Decent pay and medical accommodations at some placements
cons: It is like being trapped in high school.  Toxic rants requiring clairvoyance to understand from Adecco staff and at firms I was placed at, gas lighting, slander, verbal abuse, false accusations, and cut throat atmosphere were not in the job descriptions.  I was there to work, not fight off the mentally ill. Adecco will hire anyone who is bipedal with opposable thumbs.

pros:
It was a great job to ignite my Recruiting career.
I loved my coworkers
I was able to ask questions
Personally, I learned a lot
cons:
Very Unorganized 
Not open to teams opinions
No Communication at all, you are always in the dark until you have already put your foot in your mouth
They are SO cheap 
NO TRAINING AT ALL (if you are new you better be a fast learner)

pros:
Adecco provides an opportunity to grow internally.
Excellent Compliance and on-job training for permanent employees on a timely basis.
Win4Youth competition and other internal competition were very effective.
cons:
Attrition ratio was very high in Adecco India-North branches.  
Very poor training system to the management trainee/fresher.

review_title: Worked for two summers - great experience
pros:
Worked there for two summers during my summer breaks from college. They have plenty of resources to ensure working on an assembly line won't be too tough on you.

This is also my only experience on an assembly line and by chance I somehow got along with all of my coworkers in my area.
cons: Returning for my second summer was me essentially starting the hiring and training process from the beginning even though I had experience.

pros: Regular pay review, relatively good wage & I actually enjoy my job... shame it’s with this company
cons: Senior Leadership Team dismissive of feedback & reviews, Click Travel & Webexpenses are the bane of everyone’s lives, T&S limits are now a joke & not moved in 10 years... unless your in the SLT. Flex benefits system was abysmal this year with SLT showing no concern. A very divisive company to work for where there is no cohesion & the “usual crowd” end up on the annual holiday. There again, Greed is Good

review_title: Very technically savvy company who offers excellent employment opportunities
pros: Great Benefits. Competitive salary. Good career path advancement through the U.S. and world (largest staffing company in the world). On-going training and development classes, seminars, etc.
cons: Sometimes in this large of a company, the management needs to "walk in the shoes" of its basic employees to be able to get back to the basics of service to customers and associates.

pros:
-Supervisors are nice.
-Pay is descent.
-Job location is close to my house.
-Most times the people that you work for are nice and may give you free products!
cons:
-Job description was different from the day-to-day work that I was performing.
-No vacation or sick days.
-The people you contract for tells you to do things that Adecco says are prohibited.

review_title: Easy to get hired, you can see why
pros: Occasionally overtime is offered which can be useful if you wish to work extra hours. The ability to have flexible breaks is nice.
cons: The fast pace of the work can sometimes cause teams to become irritated with each other. Typically spend a lot of time working with the exact same people.

pros:
Company culture is positive.  They have your back and treat employees like family! 
Professional atmosphere. They have decent hours and excellent benefits. I have seen a lot of promoting within.
cons: Little guidance or training when you are new to the company.  You really need to be self sufficient to make it.

review_title: Adecco is a very professional staffing agency; though this probably depends upon your field and expertise.
pros: Professional Recruiters and the overall culture of the agency.  You're always greeted with a smile and they always make you feel as though you're an important part of the company.
cons: Employee Handbook states that their are training opportunities for computer programs; however each time I asked recruiter how I could take advantage of this, I was told that she would check into it but there was no follow-up.

pros:
Great environment for a long term career - flexible alternatives for career advancement, relocation and new opportunities. 
Individual business units have a family feel where people work together and encourage everyone's success.
Global company with a local feel.
cons:
Not enough cooperation and collaboration between business units
Need better brand recognition

pros: You can get a job here without much prior experience
cons: Under paid and over worked employees. Management does not value employees. They try to make you feel like they care by doing public gestures of acknowledgement, but this does not fix the problem of people not being valued. Turnover is extremely high and training is non existent.

pros: When Cirque du Soleil comes in town, Adecco hires 100s of people to work in the kitchen, the concession stand, and to usher.
cons:
Working on the Cirque du Soleil contract is not full time and it's not a permanent job. 

This app wants me to keep typing and I don't have anything else to share at the moment.

pros:
Coworkers are welcoming and always drop what they are doing to help teach new ways to approach tasks/problems.
Recruiting and screening process comes quickly if you put effort into it.
Lots of communication between upper management and recruiters/admin which helps understand the ins-and-outs of the staffing business
cons: Sometimes the layers of the company are difficult to manage (who is allowed to speak with hiring managers, lapses in communication between branches regarding a certain client/associate etc.)

pros: I got employment through adecco back in August of 2016. They were able to find me employment that met my needs. Close by, and no heavy lifting. 10.60 an hour (night shift). and a guaranteed 40 hour work week. (excludes holidays) Most weekends off. Set schedule. Paid weekly.
cons: boring work! Half the time i just folded boxes. But, for 10.60 an hour, its hard to complain.

pros: If you want to have very simple warehouse work, this is a no brainer. They can find you work rather quickly if they are actively staffing for a warehouse.
cons: When they hired me they said that they usually hired full-time non temp employees after the 90 day period. I worked there for almost 2 years at the same job and they didn't hire me and kept me close to minimum wage.

review_title: Flexible to life's obligations outside of work
job_title: Client Program Manager in Dayton, OH
pros: Work hard play hard; prove yourself and your able to manage the strategic direction of the branch
cons: Salaries are poorly structured tenured employees aren't awarded appropriately. Those with higher responsibilities sometimes are paid the same as those with less responsibilities yet are still held accountable for the success of their subordinates .

pros: Well known company, many branches.
cons:
Employed as a temp for the HO, as a former recruiter I feel that the recruitment process with new candidates was rushed and unprofessional. 
Compliance checks were  questionable but due to high number targets, candidates were borderline assigned to shifts! 
No training given. 
Rushed lunch breaks and limited expense alowences. 
No 1:1’s. 
Assignment Management hardly acknowledges hard working Recruitment Consultants and was never available to speak to. 
Unprofessional mannerisms when placing new candidates out to work at recruitment events. Seemed like candidates were just numbers. 
Critical candidate checks were delayed until candidates are already working due to other business needs.

review_title: A quick job, not a career though
pros:
I've worked with one other staffing agency, and this is the better of the two.  
I was allowed to call in sick more than 1 time without being fired. 
Didn't drug test, but I've seen others were drug tested. 
Health insurance was cheap (~$25/week, single no dependents)
cons:
No benefits (paid vacation) until after 1 year and at that point you are hoping to be hired in by the employer....
After 8 months still no mention of being hired in.

pros: Good pay, little interaction with actual Adecco reps
cons: They do not care about their employees AT ALL. They will ignore emails regardless of importance, expect employees to bend over backwards and change expectations for their contracted companies, and will do anything to get their bottom line. They don't vet employees or do proper background checks, leading to issues down the line, and they are incredibly inflexible with their demands- including expecting you to work on your already approved days off if it suits them.

pros: Pay during a certain  assignment started at $18
cons: Pay if you decide to stay working with the company  down to $13. The company  and adecco blames each other; company say: adecco  messed up pay, adecco  say: company  supposed to let anyone  who  wants to stay on call them so that they'd know they  would be  considered  long term and pay would reduce.  They're  both snakes.

pros: Adecco as a corporation has many opportunities for growth and advancement as long as you are in 'favor' with upper level management
cons: Sr management will promote and reward those that they favor not due to merit. IF you aren't favored then they will do all they can to push you out. Go in prepared to play the game.

pros:
- The management and recruiters are stellar
- Have many great assignments/posts in many great industries
- Very engaged and care for their people
- I personally enjoyed my time with Addecco
cons:
- Opportunities for professional growth are limited but with focused effort  on your part it is not impossible
- The pay is typically below industry average (Do not be timid in negotiating for what you're worth)

pros: The base salary is pretty good, and the environment is pretty laid back
cons: the office is small and no supervisor in the office tends to lead to some goofing off when you're trying to get work done

pros: I have no complaints they physically evaluate everyone and mentally evaluate everyone before they allow them to work at the plant. Payments have always been on time. Never had any issues.
cons: There was not really any downsides of working for adecco. Its a temp service with the ability to get hired on at honda.

pros: I worked on a fairly large project, the client & work were great, and challenging.  I worked with some great people overall. On-boarding was well done.
cons: The management team was weak and unpredictable and really didn't care if clients used & abused contractors as long as they were getting their fees. I was laid off after 2 1/2 years and was told that I would never get work with Adecco again, despite excellent reference from client,

review_title: Bad outweighs the good; Worked for Honda 8 Months
job_title: Assembly Line Worker in Marysville, OH
pros:
Best pay in Ohio for just requiring a High School Diploma 

Only 5 Days a Week weekends off,  Shutdown Periods

October bonus to all associates

great people 

Very colorful despite low diversity
cons:
Hard to move up 

Poor leadership

Takes much longer than expected to get hired in(some have worked for 4 years and are still adecco temps)

If something breaks, it's on you no questions asked.

Terrible food.

review_title: Stay Away if with Engineering background
job_title: Test Engineer in Mount Vernon, WA
pros: Not any... they get you on contract and ignore you after that.
cons: Very lazy and no representative in-person follow-up. I have worked contract in the Seattle metro area for around 12 years before taking a placement assignment with this company. If its either this place or a unemployment check - OK I get it.   Keep looking for another engineering contract outfit to represent you. This will be my first and last working relationship with Adecco.

review_title: Decent place to start to get experience as a contractor with another company
pros: A professional staffing company, fairly fast to respond, paid on time weekly
cons: no real relationship with the company, they basically just act as the middle man and your "HR." They don't seem to have a vested interest in you and your career, even though they are making money off of you. Overall not super helpful really in finding worthwhile jobs, mainly just basic temp positions it seems

pros: The only good thing about the company was the paid time off allotment however you weren't allowed to use any time from September through December.
cons: I don't know where to start. The stress was unbearable. The pay is pathetic. Management expects you to do the job that needs 2-3 additional people and you get written up if you don't get it done. Worst company experience I've ever had. During my exit interview with corporate I voiced my concerns and they ran their mouth to the manager about everything I discussed. Very unprofessional

review_title: International company but very hard to make a permanent contract, nice environment
pros:
Dynamic environment, intimate atmosphere, flexible working hours, middle good salary.
Working in Adecco Italy for sure brings you various job opportunities after working like a period of one year it’s easy to find another job outside the Adecco.
cons: Learning new stuff is a great challenge, this is my personal experience, people don’t share their knowledge with each other and this might waste your whole time while working there, some managers are not good listeners

pros: If you are fit this place is for you, hard work but you do get rewarded and looked after, great management treat you as an individual and all treated equally. Great work colleagues who make it worth while. Really will work with you if you need any help or advice.
cons: Hard work as you would expect walking and on your feet all day, if you like fast paced and ever changing environment this can be the place for you.

review_title: I was working in Adecco permanant recruitment division
pros:
Adecco is an MNC and being No. 1 company in the world in Placements / Consultancy sector.
Being an MNC the company do provide Good Salaries and Perks. 
Some good HR practices are followed by company like celebrating Birthdays of each employees in that month.
cons:
Indian leadership is not that good Professionally. 
learning Opportunities are Low.
No interest taken by the company for training of their employees.

review_title: Be careful with what you are signing up for...
job_title: Client Relationship Consultant in Rochester, NY
pros: Good people work there.  I developed friendships there.
cons: Lack of advancement, poor salary, relentless pressure and pace of position, work life balance is lacking, promises made about career advancement but rarely delivered, and Ideas from subordinates rarely listened to.

review_title: Great Company with a few failings
pros: Great opportunities for top performers.
cons: Promotions tend to be based on a sorority membership or connection.  Many members of management lack skills, but have the right friends.  Could use a little chemotherapy to get rid of this cancerous problem.

pros: I was always paid on time. If a problem arose it was handled quickly. Pre-hire questions were answered very quickly. Communication with representatives was very good.
cons: I only worked as a contractor so I don't have the perspective of an employee of Adecco. There was not an opportunity for me to go full time with the company I was working with, but that wasn't really any one's fault.

pros: Great consultants, HR and work culture. Fun environment.   Great work benefits and flexible environment. Global transfers are a possibility as worldwide.
cons: Too focused on money than lasting relationships.  Too much focus on management than consultants.  Not much support if management don't all agree.

pros: Working as a contract worker or a temporary worker provides great flexibility. You can also specify what type of assignment or work that you are looking for...full-time, part-time, etc...
cons: Within my Adecco office there was a lot of turnover and as a result it was hard to know who to talk to when you had a question or concern because the last person that you spoke with was no longer working there.

job_title: Senior Account Executive in New York, NY
pros: Largest staffing agency in the world. Brand name recognition for potential clients.
cons: 28 different Adecco companies do not work together, do not maintain similar rate cards/sales organization, nor develop proper sales delivery to match client needs. The Technical division has progressively lost market share, and have no strategy to win it back over effective sales organizations.

pros: The company makes sure that you are employed... and working
cons: Not enough positions available for candidates who possess a (4) four year degree, bachelors or higher. Always having to start at the bottom.

pros: Company truly cares about its team and inspiring you to grow. They train extensively to bring you up to speed, being a recruiter consists of interviewing, submitting candidates and making sure you meet all contract requirements.
cons: Turnover sometimes due to changes within management, salary is on the low side, retention would definitely change if compensation was up to par with the competition.

pros: Global and Professional experience which you will learn a lot here. Great CSR activities, well infrastructure to support your work. Fair performance management which is very systematic. They do quite good in Employee branding.
cons: How to deal with uncontrollable condition, pressure, expectation from Client, Candidate and yes, your boss. Speed! You must be very proactive people to achieve your KPI, well self management, disciplinary and well planning skills.

pros: Project I am currently on has flexible schedule.  My main point of contact with Adecco is very professional and capable
cons: Recruiters will stretch the truth very thin.  Available benefits are not great.  Very poor communication.  Will hire recklessly, lots of bad hires on my current project.

pros: Colleagues are nice, they work hard, listen to your opinion and appreciate team work. There are also pretty much opportunities of training for young employees, and transfer within companies (different branches). If you do pretty good, the company gives good bonus & incentives.
cons: Basic pay and raise is slow, management change company strategies often. Retention rate is also high.

job_title: Warehouse Operator in Saint Albans, VT
pros: They placed me in a job
cons: I feel taking advantage of. We get no raises thru company. They do not care about us employees. They see $$$$ thats all we mean. I've been with them for 2 years never miss time, never late, work OT. I don't even get a praise " Hey, Good job"  "Thanks for the time you put in" (LINE THEIR pockets) . No calls "just to check in" See how its going. NOTHING

pros:
Worked w/ public sector and found faster pay increases than permanent employees of same level

The relationship between 'Staff' and 'Candidates' - once in a job - is distant but at least black and white and therefore I found it consistent. 

My tip - use the phone and call, I never needed to use the website.
cons: Same as working for any temp agency (Job insecurity & you are an office monkey that no-one gets to know/develop)

review_title: Good company to start off at.
pros:
*Great place to start off at if switching industries. 
*Love my team of colleagues I work with daily.
cons:
*PAY - the pay is terrible, and forget raises. Not going to happen
*A lot of talk but no real action, seems some higher management just brush things off
*Need more up to date recruiting tools
*Not a lot of room to grow
*Doing work outside of your position and not being compensated fairly

pros: Really friendly staff who are always supportive. They try and find you the most suitable roles.
cons: If there's no work in your area (if you are limited by public transport), then you just have no work.  Payroll is also difficult, as your individual manager at the temporary site must submit your hours by a certain day of the week. If this is not submitted, you are not paid. This can be very stressful and out of your control.

pros: The work environment is in the library so it is quiet, the workload of the job is quite low and you can have a break if you finish all the things.
cons: The company may assign you to different library in Hong Kong, sometimes the work location is far away from home and need to spend time to arrive the workplace.

review_title: It could be a lot worse but it is definitely not great.
pros: It's a job, you will get a paycheck and it will be for more than many other 'no experience required' jobs.
cons: It varies significantly based on placement. Everything is really secretive and there is no security that you are still going to have a job tomorrow, but that is the nature of temp work. The employee has absolutely no power in this relationship, at times it feels like indentured servitude.

review_title: Never get a chance grow or Recognize, Discrimination is a Making people to quit.
pros: Made good friends but most of them left for Their Career growth
cons:
Old routine job never get a chance to learn new things or Never listen for new Ideas. Knowledge, Education and Experience never Count. EVerything Justification are on top.
Difficult to manage work-life balance.
Managers requires intensive training to treat their peers in respective instead of Slaves.
Stressful Atmosphere.

pros: Management frequently empowered employees of all levels to have an impact on the company. They were good at recognizing and cultivating talent.
cons: Salary was frequently below an individuals contribution level. Which would lead to them moving on not because they wanted to but because they would feel financially undervalued.

pros: Great place to work. Good company taking care of people. Fair environment and the possibility of getting full time in possible.
cons: Length of time until getting hired can take a little more time than willing to put in but the outcome is worth the wait.

pros: The office I worked in had a great time that cared about the people who worked for us. Everyone I worked with was very passionate about their role.
cons: There were many times that clients would need last minute hires. Finding people for this type of positions was a disaster as well as very stressful.

job_title: Administrative Assistant in New York, NY
pros: You get to try assignments all over the city and five boroughs. You are screened and background checked so that helps the job process along.
cons: They take half your check and leave you alone to fend for yourself for the most part. They only call you to make sure your pay check info is submitted on time, let that go a few days and they are on you .

review_title: Very Shady Management and Corprate office need to be investigated in accounting and discrimination
pros: Highest Pay rate out of all the Saffing Companies
cons:
•	They use a psychologist to interview you 
•	They do not stand behind their employees 
•	They recently lied to the state of Oregon and was caught
•	You are a contract and can be terminated at any time 
•	Save any and all document including emails that are sent make sure you  forward everything to your personal email
•	This is staffing company who places nonqualified people in positions that do not fit to meet their sales quota 
•	They are recruiters  and have quota to fill

review_title: If your face doesn't fit, you're finished.
pros: A new MD who cares, let's see if things change as and she listens to her staff. Previous MD liked to ask what staff shared but action was very slow or not forthcoming at all.
cons: Poor IT systems, inconsistent training, low salary, very difficult bonus scheme, unfair treatment, unfair promotions, frequent management changes.

pros: Adecco is great for the short term contract...they are very helpful, always available to help. Nice, friendly people that work there.
cons: Benefits...paid holidays...paid time off...sick pay....None. It makes it tough when you don't get paid holidays...which are closed days for the company. Those at least should be paid. Especially during the holidays...no time off. :-( makes it hard, they really should take a second look at that, because it's hard enough being only a temp employee.

review_title: Love love love working here!  Best company I've worked for so far.
pros:
Work hard, play hard.  
Focused on communication.
Corporate HQ listens-open to new ideas.  
Awesome benefits.
Down-to-earth upper management.
Constantly improving processes
Striving to improve workplace approval.
cons:
Recent relocation from NY offered many new jobs.  However, 200 people starting at the same time makes it hard to get promoted.  
401(k) only ok.

review_title: Honda was extremely hard work but overall it was a secure opportunity
pros: They definitely do what they can to place you at the best job according to what they can do.
cons: If you have a medical condition of any kind they on the really place you on a different assignment

pros: Telecommuting has its pros and cons but I enjoyed it. The definitely seemed to be a bias towards east coast hours however.
cons: Staffing just isn't the most lucrative of fields. I think all employees received a 4% salary decrease in 08 or 09. Never to be recouped.

review_title: A temp through the company Adecco currently working in a factory.
pros: The company is easy to work with, if somethings wrong I can easily get it solved, and they gave me a job opportunity.
cons: The major cons to the company is that if something goes wrong with payment and checks then it's a big hassle to get it solved.

pros: The pay was decent and the workers were helpful when locating a temp job for you. They did help me when I had an issue with one of the companies.They contacted the company to set up a meeting to discuss the issue that I had.
cons: The only thing I didn't like about them was how they waited to tell you the next day when you were heading to the job that they no longer needed temp workers there.

pros: Good place to work, fun teams, good earning potential. a great place to get an HR career started. Lots of exposure to business in general, lots to learn here. I spent 5 years with the company and enjoyed most of my time.
cons: Too many high level manager that don't seem to communicate what is being delegated to the employees below.

review_title: They can get you in to a job quickly
pros: Have contracts with some of the biggest distribution companies that are always hiring.
cons: Benefits, no paid time off, raises but this all depends on if you're full or part time and whether you can get hired on where you're placed.

review_title: A waste of my professional career and time; stagnant.
pros: By Adecco being a large corporation one of the few advantages I can think of are that they have many outlets to educational resources to ultimately equip you to promote their agenda of remaining the world;s largest staffing provider.
cons: Adecco does not foster. implement nor facilitate diversity. There is no room for growth for minorities; when you do a salary to salary comparison to minorities against others it is a gross disparity.

pros: Had job security because management kept changing and they needed someone that knew the business.
cons: Work-life balance was difficult to maintain at the branch level; branches were understaffed and branch managers were constantly changing not allowing for anyone to get to know recruiters and/or supervisors.  difficult to advance within company.  Pay scale is very low compared to other staffing companies.

pros: Management is very attentive and open to all varieties of feedback. I actually believe my opinion counts
cons: benefits could be better. And the commission structure is pretty on par with competitors, but of course I'd like to see that grow!

pros: You get paid weekly. You will have a great experience working for Adecco, if they like you.
cons: Poor organization within the office. For me, because of their lack of organization, I had to wait about 1 month to 1.5 months to get placed. Not because of me but because they thought I was employed, even though I had told them otherwise on several occasions.

pros: Big name recognition assisted with sales, etc.
cons:
Terrible benefits.

Lot of VMS orders. This is when a large company sends an email to a dozen recruiting firms like throwing a bone in to a pack of wild dogs. You can't talk to managers, for IT and Engineering related positions this is a huge issue. Almost the antithesis of staffing!

pros: The only good thing about working at the Kodak site was the fact that the employees were good people
cons: This is the worst place to work, they have no clue what they are doing. I was working for the Kodak campaign and it was terrible. Management was only interested in people they could either sleep with or manipulate to be yes men/women. Whenever asking for the HR department we were constantly rerouted to different departments to eventually told to go to the head of our department which was the source of all of our problems.

job_title: Regional Account Director in Raleigh, NC
pros: Ability to support national and international clients. Corporate proposal team was a tremendous help responding to RFPs with quick turnaround.
cons: Extremely large company with tremendous up and downs, financially. Difficult to implement and properly communicate policies given so many people need to be involved to implement. Mass layoffs are a majority reality following two to three down quarters.

pros: There are no good things about Adecco
cons: Their competition pays holidays after so many days- weeks of services - Also heard of some paying for vacation after time.  They do not give you anything.  I would NOT work for them again.  They need to revisit their policies as well as their competition

pros: Adecco is like a family, there are many great people working there. I really enjoyed my time there. I had a lot of opportunity early in my career.
cons: Too many management changes. Direction always seem to be changing. You can get "stuck" in a position and not be able to get out.

review_title: The Grass Is ALWAYS Greener On The Other Side
pros: It's a fairly easy company to by employed by... there's not a lot of hoops you have to jump through.
cons: The lack of communication is very difficult to have to deal with, as is the reasoning (or lack there of) of overhiring.

review_title: Best temp agency overall - I've worked with many
pros:
They take the time to get to know what you need/want.
They have a good variety of jobs.
They do call you if you let them know you're available.
cons:
Quality of the interactions depends on the rep that you work with.
If you don't refuse jobs that don't fit you they may hold it against you.

review_title: Good place for a sales career
pros: Pro - generous rewards for sales force, energetic and motivated sales managment, willing to cut losses on a bad hire
cons: Clients also hire factory workers, (slim profit margins) so physical offices are very bare bones and not appealing to the professional job seeker

pros: Was placed at one of my dream companies to work for.
cons:
1. Crappy Pay
2. Borning Positions
3. Don't care about their employees, just the customer who has purchased their services
4. Not easy to approach about issues
5. Not responsive when you have a problem
6. Prefer you to NOT have contact with their customer - even if that person is your "boss when you are contracted"
7. RUDE EMPLOYEES
8. Take forever to get paperwork to you
9. Very unprofessional
10. Took all benefits away from their employees
11. High turnover in positions due to lack of pay & benefits!

pros: I liked working with the temporary staff and the businesses. There was excellent opportunity for training.
cons: They would offer higher salaries, etc. to the people who weren't carrying their weight to keep from getting sued from firing people. I worked twice as hard and was training everyone only to find out I make $5K less than everyone else despite being the only Recruiter with a college degree.

review_title: Customer Service Rep at Insurance Company
job_title: Customer Service Representative in West Warwick, RI
pros: Pretty much left me on my own. When I did need help they got on it right away. I turned a 3 month assignment into 15 months with an increase in pay when moving to another department.
cons: I was told it would turn into a permanent position. Not true. Other temps, form other agencies, were also told the same thing so it could have been the company I worked for.

pros: A lot of responsability since day one, awesome team including the ones that are kilometers away, we all feel like part of the same family.
cons: If they want, and when they want, they will not hesitate to kick you out, regardless of the fact of how long you have been in the company, your numbers, your ratings... If you are not in the plans, you will not be included (as usually happens in big multinational companies)

pros: Great PTO and benefits as a Colleague and the opportunity to learn many different aspects of recruitment and account management.
cons: Turnover is very high and the moral in the office is very negative. Your success and happiness at this company truly depends on the accounts you have and your manager.

pros: Job is rewarding in that we help people find work that can better their life.  Great benefits.
cons: Current leadership is so far removed in understanding the operations of a local branch.  Promotions continue go people with limited qualifications and/or no track record.

pros: Good pay for what you have to do, don’t have to interact with too many people, it’s a great work environment for an introvert or someone who hates working retail or fast food where there’s always people talking to you or you have to be nice to everyone all the time
cons: The work can get monotonous, you aren’t allowed to have your phone out, the people can treat the place like their second home

review_title: Adecco Group North America - Melville, NY
pros: Adecco is full of clock watchers, so the pros are "No Overtime work"
cons:
Lack of career growth and poor compensation. 

Once pay is reasonable and fair, other things become important: recognition, respect, challenging work, opportunities for development… the feeling that a job is more than just a job.

review_title: Contract work can end at anytime
pros: I actually work as a Recruiter for Adecco - as a contract employee. Great pay, hours, lunch break, perks, own cube.... fun place to be!
cons: Contract employees can be removed at anytime.

pros: Fun place to work. lots of growth for your career. great planning from upper management.  working 6 hour days it the best in the town for them
cons: the drive to work was some times slow but i blame the city for not having like thirty or fourty lane roads and shuttles. let workers go home earlier than 4 o clocl

review_title: Adecco Does Not Treat Us Right
pros: The only pro is having a job.
cons: No vacation or holiday pay....insurance is basically nonexistent.

pros: Quickly got me working a Job in my field. Were very respectful of my needs and desires. I enjoy working with the staff
cons: The pay might not be that great for the jobs. You might get sent on jobs that are tedious. But you can say no.

pros: Tons of resources for successful recruiting. With the right attitude it's not hard to do well. I am very impressed with Adecco's commitment to employee professional development, health, diversity, and work life balance.
cons: It appears the administrators are overworked and possibly under valued. I believe Recruiters can't be successful without a Operations.

job_title: NCU Agent in College Station, TX
pros: I have enjoyed my work experience and was always well informed. The process of applying was easy and quick. The recruiter knew what she was doing , everything went smoothly and the work was enjoyable.
cons: I don't have any cons about this job and i was very happy to come in to work everyday.

pros:
- Multinational Recruitment & HR company
- Great internal development opportunities if you work hard & talk to the right people
- Don't hold you back if you have the ability to grow 
- Good bonus structure for motivated, hard workers
cons:
- Starting salaries for grads not wonderful
- Long working hours
- As with all recruitment companies, there are unsavoury "lifers" that will try to make your job difficult

review_title: It was a great learning experienc as far learning and picking up new skills
pros: controlled environment and a very clean place to work a fast pace job when everything is working correctly. We got paid weekly that was a plus
cons: When the machines wasn't working right it would be a lot of down time and the temps. would be the first to go home and it was temporary position things subject to change at any time.

pros: No long wait to start employment once selected, learn the contracted job, and potential to gain full-time employment with actual contractor.
cons: No leave or paid holidays until after 1000 hrs are worked, health insurance deduction is a crazy amount, if you have questions regarding job there is no POC available, starting pay is does no measure your experience or worth, No pay increase until after a year IF contract is renewed and still not guaranteed..

pros: Did a great job finding me summer placements at great (Fortune 500) companies over the summer while in college.  Both companies I worked with gave me an offer at the end of the summer.  Pay rate was great and the experience and daily work was challenging and fun.
cons: No cons I can think of unless you just don't like the idea of contract work (but permanent options and direct hire are options).

review_title: Great place if your looking for a temp job or to get your foot in the door
pros: Great people, helpful and friendly staff. If you need a temp job or just starting, they will call you with a job that is most applicable to your skill set.
cons: Sometimes you can go a few days to a week without work, but its not often. No other cons I can think of.

pros: Paychecks were always on time. Friendly Human Resources personnel. Seemed to have many resources and business relationships.
cons: Too many layers of management. Did not follow through with help finding me further employment after existing contract was expiring. Left me swinging in the wind.

review_title: Why Adecco is the go-to when you're new in town.
pros: Adecco is fabulous at matching you to the right position  because of the profile they build of you to start. They are thorough.
cons: If you haven't had an assignment  in 6 months,  you have to go through all the sign up process again.

review_title: Temporary Staffing Placements at Bayer Healthcare
job_title: Quality Control Labs Administrative Assistant in Emeryville, CA
pros: Adecco was the only temporary agency used by this employer. That allowed them advance notice of other opportunities so temporary staff could make internal lateral moves for new opportunities.
cons: Organizational changes within both Bayer and  Adecco made communication with Adecco about employment changes difficult. Followup from Adecco was slow and unclear.

pros: I have been working with Adecco for five years, and it always has been the most challenge job that I have never had before. Interviewing candidates, dealing with clients, and chasing daily sales targets which have made this job very challenging. The hard work will pay off when you have a big bonus $$$$$$$$ every pay day. Awesome job!!!!
cons: The Org is too big to take care of all clients

pros: Positive, caring company culture!  Opportunities to grow professionally, help make a difference in other's lives and make a very good living doing something I love.  Work very close to home! Impressive tenure within the leadership team. Learning organization!
cons: Wish more people knew that Adecco provided Direct-Hire services not just temporary services

pros: They will find you a job quickly
cons: Very few levels to advance into. If you get hurt on the job, be prepared to find a whole new job. They will tell  you that your job will still be available once you are cleared to return to work, but the reality is that they put someone in your place almost instantly and they "might" try to find you work once you can return.

pros: Leader in the industry.  Good compensation structure and incentives.   National presence provides credible backing to potential clients when making marketing calls.
cons: Company and management tend to micro manage its employees excessively by keeping unnecessary metrics and requires employees to submit unnecessary reports on a weekly basis

pros: They were flexible with my hours and stayed in great contact with me whenever I needed any help or had questions.
cons: Sometimes they only have jobs with seasonal or temporary listings, but still overall great company to work for. It got me on the right track towards my career.

pros: The pay is good if you are in a contract position. There maybe a good chance of getting contract opportunities in future as well.
cons:
they dont have the best benefits package.
Nor do they have a good holiday pay service. It is almost impossible to get paid for time off.

review_title: If they call, run in the other direction
pros: They get you working fast.
cons: They could care less if you get paid on time. They will low ball contractors vs other agencies. I worked along side another contractor on a jobsite, and he was making $5 an hour more through his agency, and we where doing the same job. No support.

pros: Finds you a job right away, if you are in need of one. If you are willing to work, they have something for you.
cons: Pay is better working at a fast food joint! After taxes and all, you work 40+ hours a week, & still have to choose between paying rent or eating for the week.

review_title: Poorly Paid, no attention to employyes..
pros: they find you work quickly
cons: poorly paid, no benefits, even city mandated time given for sick days is very hard to use.  Getting wages adjusted when promotions happen is very difficult.  If you have a problem with anything, the office is hard to get a hold of and not receptive.

job_title: Field Marketing Services Director in Bucharest, Bucuresti
pros: The Company manage to counterbalance the potentially low pay and lack of benefits with other perks such as the option to work from home.
cons: You are not  generally given time to train and acclimate to the company’s systems. You feel the immediate pressure of your job and targets.

pros: Adecco is filled with amazing people, many of whom are committed to their work. There is a collaborative atmosphere and everyone is quite social.
cons: The company doesn't look after people. The turnover rate is incredibly high and the culture of the company is next to non existent.

review_title: It was a good experience I got a lot of jobs and they kept me busy.
pros: The staff is caring and they really want you to work. Although since moving to Charlotte I haven't had the success I had in Charlottesville,VA.
cons: If you don't get on a long term assignment you may have to wait around for someone to call or hire you.

pros: Great way to get into big companies, and to explore new options. I got a contract to hire with GE through adecco.
cons: They don't really check on you, no benefits and I'm sure they can afford to pay you alot more than they say.

pros: It's a job with a paycheck.
cons:
-Grossly underpaid compared to every factory job in the area, with a higher skillset needed.
-Every year vacations and benefits are cut, we just lost bonuses this year.  No benefits in sight.
-No ability for upward growth or promotion.
-WIll lie to your face saying they are attempting to negotiate raises as they cut your pay and benefits.
-Do the same/more work as actual company employees in the area, but Adecco contractors are paid less than half with no benefits.
-Incredibly high turnover rate because of the afformentioned qualities, always working with new untrained induviduals because they cannot keep employees.

pros: Great Pay, Great work/ life balance, Great working environment and Great co workers.
cons: I really enjoy my job. I don't wake up unhappy and I don't go home upset. Management really listens to your needs and take quick action to meet them

job_title: I Was Trying to Get Into Customer Service From Social Services in Westminster, CO
pros: Great company to work for.  They called me with opportunities.  I would recommend especially to get in new field of work.  I was let go from a job and they called back with new jobs.
cons: One time I was not able to get check at work and friend went to get check for me.  I am not sure why that happened.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in New Milton, England
pros: I really can't think of any.
cons:
At interview I was asked by the manager 'you're not planning to get pregnant anytime soon are you?'
They will expect you to pick things up very quickly without sufficient training... which is worrying when you consider what is at stake with the vulnerable, elderly customers that use the service.
There is very little parking, you will be blocked in every day
The systems they use are antiquated, hard to navigate and unnecessarily confusing
There is a very catty, clicky atmosphere, especially from female managers if you are a young female.
They only seem to employ white people.

review_title: Very great experience and open community for anything an employee needs for work and advice.
pros: I like how the company has multiple offers for employment at different sites and can transfer employees within the Adecco groups working environment. The opportunities are endless.
cons: I haven't found any cons as of yet, maybe if any the different places adecco hasn't acquired in contracts yet to employ workers.

pros: Fast paced environment in which daily tasks vary.  Opportunity to interact with people on a daily basis.  Great office environment.
cons: Sometimes client expectations can be unrealistic, but that is the nature of the field.  Outdated, or otherwise inefficient technology is all that is given.

pros: decent work environment, chance for travel. The job is what you make it
cons: completely disorganised management teams. Poor IT. as an HR company their HR is the pits. Business Model is outdated. Very focused on conformist attitudes and groupthink. No training or development

pros:
Adecco has great name recognition.
Good support from other recruiters on my team.
Uncapped commissions.
Provide good resources to source for candidates.
cons:
Archaic technology.
Take a month to pay out on commissions after the client pays.
Silo mentality - often compete with other departments within the company

pros: Pros - great colleagues, true teamates, "we're all in this together" mentality.  Very fast paced environment, if you're sales driven you will thrive here!
cons: Cons - low pay for the commitment required to succeed.  Very little training and instruction on how do your job on the day to day.  Only results matter.  (This could be a Pro for some)

review_title: Great place to work right out of college
pros: Working with multiple clients in different lines of work gives you great exposure to different industries, great PTO/benefits, managers have an open door, and are willing to promote and develop career paths
cons: you work with a lot of crazy temps, employees are stretched pretty thin, not a lot of room for growth unless you want to go into sales since headquarters is in NY

pros: Great work life balance and a social atmosphere although a hard working environment.  Good time off policies, fair with excellent HR policies and procedures and support.

review_title: Good place to work. Found me the job for my temperament and skills.

cons: You have to push them to find you work, since they have so many employees looking for work and just so many clients; I would've preferred more help as a former employee though

pros: Great experience to learn about recruiting and corporate research. It was a unique internship opportunity. Located in Tampa Florida.
cons: Long commute from home. I worked long hours over the summer but I had very flexible breaks. Great company. Would do it again.

pros: Just got in. The people are nice and patient. The working environment is clean and they have lockers for almost everybody.
cons: The time is not good. I work from2:30 to 11:30 pm. Sometime I work overtime until 1:00 am. Not big fan.

review_title: Deployed on contract to Cisco Systems
pros: Good work environment. Would work on issues that you have raised.
cons:
Very late replies regarding your hike and contract reissuing with the company. 
No arrears and no incentives.
Once if you are laid off from the place you have been deployed, Adecco is not responsible for fixing people some where else in other projects.

job_title: Tier II Agent in Melbourne, FL
pros: Early in season, great training. Extra time available.  Busy work environment.
cons: You can be on time, there for every shift, but there's no communication if something goes wrong. But everyone else will know.

pros: Great candidate base. Great coworkers and management. Positive place to work. Here we work well together as a team to get the job .
cons: Competitive pay with benefits. The employees here  are not trained. You basically are put in a position to  sink or swim.

job_title: Machine Operator/Coater in Lake Forest, CA
pros: There office was nice, SOME of the people were cool...
cons: I could go on forever about poor management, incompetents, poor impressions, miscommunication, disrespect, not to mention how much of a cut there probable making off your hard work, while they do nothing. Here's the bottom line, DON'T GO TO WORK FOR ADECCO! Trust me your better off checking around, there are better agencies out there!

pros: My contact at Adecco is nice and generally responsive, though sometimes you have to email them more than once to get a response. I have been in a full-time position for almost 2 years and thought I would be hired, but that is not happening anytime soon, though that is more the fault of the company I am working for and not Adecco.
cons: No major cons I can think of

review_title: Nice company as it is MNC group
pros: It is very nice opportunity to work with MNC group, and it is widely spread almost 100 above countries
cons: It is not growth taking earlier, you have to wait for your growth towards company, you are the best you have to prove first

pros: It was a steady income for awhile.
cons: Was not informed of everything required to get hired on permanent for company. I tried everything possible to keep the job, but was still let go by the perspective employer. Had to do a lot of work for low wages.

pros: Reputation. Latitude to try new things. Good atmosphere. Great people to work with. Team spirit really present. Less micromanagement than other recruitment firms.
cons:
Higher Management do not listen. No flexibility.
Really low salaries for recruiters. No equity. Favoritism. No salary raises each year.

review_title: Working as an employee of adecco has been one of the best jobs I’ve ever had. Highly recommend this company.
pros: Pros of working with regional acceptance are the benefits and also the work experience you gain.
cons: Some cons of working with regional acceptance as a collections representative are the fast pace and the amount of calls you had to get to through within the days period.

pros: People are very friendly and nice to work with.
cons: This is not a graduate role- work is menial and micro managed, they make easy tasks more difficult than they need to be.

review_title: An entrepreneurial environment that encourages thought leadership
pros: Autonomy, growth opportunities, people, leadership, growth industry, benefits, competitive compensation.
cons: Long hours and a great deal of travel.  It is a start up division within a larger orgainziation.  It's what makes it exciting and overwhelming all at the same time.  External pressure buy the buyer to deliver programs for less.

pros: Very friendly. The entire hiring process was very quick. Helped me get placed in a position I really wanted instead of placing me where I was initially considered for.
cons: Poor communication throughout the process. Had to continually probe for information to find out where I was in the hiring process.

pros: Great company and people to work with. They really care about their people. They always look out for you and any needs you may have
cons: They don't care about people's feelings. They continuously make changes within the organization and dont consider the changes that people have to deal with. They  constantly do not make you feel comfortable being here. They make you feel unwelcomed.

review_title: Joobs opportunity but Adecco can give work only one day or if you are lucky all week
pros: The best reason to work for Adecco is to find many jobs  opportunity.
cons: The downside of work for Adecco is jobs on the phone. You newer how much work they will have for you. Adecco can give work only one day or if you are lucky all week. No possible to make a plan.

job_title: Call Center Agent in Eau Claire, WI
pros: Pay is decent, still not enough to live on but better than most places. Staff is friendly and were able to set me up with a job right away on 2 separate occasions.
cons: No sick days and low pay. Staff can be dismissive at times.

review_title: Stack, Pack,  Dump Bottles,  Rotate The Line
pros: One of the best thing I can best describe to work at this kind of facility is that it is very easy and not so much of a hard job like most temp jobs.
cons: The people who stir up to much drama and snitching on people , which they don't pay enough for that kind of easy work in the faculty

job_title: Customer Service Technician in Eau Claire, WI
pros: They partner with some really good companies.  The one I was with had a great atmosphere and really good food options.
cons: Received my first paycheck a week late.  Was told that I would be working 40 hours per week (both verbally and in writing).  Turns out it was 30-40 hours per week and they never told me that.  I found out about it on the company intranet.

job_title: Customer Service Representative in Jersey City, NJ
pros: Adecco's pay rate is better than average, and the clientele is first rate.  They are  a temporary agency.
cons: Vetting is intense, and time consuming.  Often, the jobs are not due to start immediately and,  you may have to wait for weeks, even months for an assignment to begin.

pros: Great salary. Plenty of shifts available. Good facilities. A good place to learn and get better at your job. Progression is there if wanted.
cons: Long shifts sometimes make it difficult to maintain concentration. Work can be very repetitive and sometimes boring.

review_title: Started off as a good thing, then it changed.
pros: Pay was decent with temp to permanent.
cons:
There was a long time between jobs.
My representative put me on inactive because I could continue a job due to circumstances beyond my control and wouldn't tell me, even after several times trying to contact. The manager finally responded and told me.

pros: I enjoy working 12-hour shifts, especially night shifts. Also, working 4 days meant that I had 4 full days off which is handy and means I am able to have a social life as well as a working life. The pension scheme looks very competitive and very good too.
cons: The shifts were not always guaranteed hours every week as I was working with agency rather than as a permanent worker

pros: Faclities were modern and better than average.  Orientation was adquate but not as professional as could have been.  Peers were helpful.
cons: Upper management did not interact with recruiters and provide updates on new information or upcoming changes.  Expectations were not outlined and defined.

pros: Adecco has some of the best people working for them.  The overall product is good, great resources for employees to use.
cons: Management  team not interested in what employees have to say

pros:
Location of the office (easily accessible from major roads)
Generous personal time off benefits
Well maintained office building
Easy interview process
cons:
Salary is on the lower side of businesses in the area
Diversity is at the forefront, often hurting processes and procedures

review_title: Bring in new accounts or you have no job.
pros:
Compensation
Benefits
Very cool training program
Opportunity to build relationships in your area
Generous time off when needed
Ability to work from home
cons: Senior management seems to be very lax and they are okay with the burn and churn of recriters and account execs.

job_title: Customer Service Representative in High Point, NC
pros: It is a company that is known and also has a broad range of offices so that a transfer is possible if relocating.
cons: They staff so many that the staff does not really get to know the employee and that can be unfortunate in some situations.

pros: I don't have anything really good to say about Adecco staffing, I wish I did but they are terribly ran!!
cons: I hate Adecco and how they treat me, I got two days pay I didn't get paid for bc they said I wasn't there which I was!! 24 hours of pay, not paid for, they said I quit which I also did not!! And they said I said I was going to run my truck through there building...psssshhhh! smh

pros:
No face to face interview
No face to face contact throughout the entire recruitment process

cons:
Poor communication
No consistent point of contact in organisation
No understanding of client / candidate match
Would not provide job specification
No details provided for the role and location until one working day before start of the contract
