pros: you get paid every week is very nice
cons:
so far lies, lies. I promised that the assignment that I am at now I would be full time in about 6 to 8 months. well it has been over an year and nothings has changed
 
the management of the site that I work at is very unprofessional and lack a slew of skill set to maintain and operate as company.

review_title: Recruiting company, NOT a performance mgmt company
pros: Get to work with very talented clients and grow there.
cons: The set up in terms of feedback is muddled. My Client mgr would tell the Adecco Rep what's wrong - then Adecco would tell me. Anytime I had more questions/want more details - they couldn't provide info (as they didn't know what the root issues).

review_title: I worked for Adecco 17 months, left because of personal reason
job_title: Technical Support Analyst in Sofia, Sofia (city)
pros: Young people, motivating environment, chance to grow
cons: HR employees do not know anything about their work, very poor benefits - food vouchers 30  euro per month and for Christmas, we got only one decoration ball  for the Christmas tree. Their outsourcing works against the employees and only steals money they are worth.

review_title: Worst company ever! Their HR aka account managers/executives are a bunch of scammers!
pros: You won't find any in this company.
cons:
- poor working hours, no work-life balance whatsoever, no payment for any overtime work provided, tight and unreasonable deadlines that will wreck your physical health
- no way to provide any sort of feedback to management, even if feedback is given, no reaction from management whatsoever
- treated like slaves by the account managers & client, "the HR" aka account managers don't care about employee welfare, they only care about licking the boots of management at the client company
- no prospect of career growth or advancement whatsoever, no opportunities for acquiring/developing marketable skills, instead YOU the person who joined Adecco are expected to master all kinds of skills for which you will NOT be compensated at the market rate
- they are often late on salary payment, blatantly breaking the employment law
- the HR people who managed us, who are grandiosely titled as "account managers" scammed us into joining Adecco by withholding vital information, such as the nature of the outsourcing arrangement between Adecco and the client, thus many were led to believe that they would be solely managed by the client company w/o interference from Adecco with the exception of payroll and benefits. They also promised us the possibility of converting into employees under client payroll when that is not even possible.
-no employee benefits at all, once you join expect nothing but slavery and exploitation from BOTH the client and Adecco 
- Constant micromanaging from both the client and Adecco, toxic working environment, rude, petty and condescending managers everywhere around you, no wonder the client company wants us to be under Adecco so that they can abuse us to their hearts' contents without incurring any risks
-In summary, by joining Adecco, you will become a tool for big corporations (the client) to abuse and exploit your labour without endangering themselves, and in return you will not have any form of job security or benefits from either party. 
I would not wish for my worst enemy to join Adecco.

review_title: Adecco is a positive environment to work in.
pros: They are always finding ways to improve your job opportunities.  They reward when you are doing an excellent job.  They tell you what an asset you are to the company.  Very positive work environment.
cons: They keep you on as an temporary employee.

review_title: Loved my old boss - then they caused so much drama!
pros: Loved all that I learned from my previous Branch Manager. Then they brought in someone horrible and wouldn't give us any support to get things back to where they should have been.
cons: Sacrificed a lot of great employees just because they didn't want the drama.

pros: You get to learn lots of things even if you have not done education in it. friendly atmosphere.
cons: Lots of politics, late sittings and unprofessional attitude. If you have worked with a big company of repute then you have to handle things with care.

pros: Reliable employment agency with good connections and job opportunities in a variety of industry.
cons: Does not keep former employees apprised of new opportunities for training, of job change for them to take advantage of  especially when they move out of state.

pros: Provided a fare salary, if you made enough hours you could earn a bonus. They do offer insurance and 401K.
cons: No holiday pay, no pay raise for more when responsibilities increase. Rarely any contact from recruiter even though they were stationed on site.

pros: They pay you every Friday and will help to find you another job. One of the oldest temp service still around.
cons: That's just not enough work for you to become a full time employee. It's like when the third month comes, they don't need you any more.

review_title: WORST PERSONAL EXPERIENCE EVER. DON'T JOIN.
pros:
-Stable amount of business 
-Lots of interesting national accounts
-No sales responsibilities for any of the recruiters at the branch level, just service
-Marketing power - first company to come up on google
-Recruiters are all young and very kind, very friendly
cons:
-Perm commission structure sucks - you can make at most 10% of the fee if you manage the account and supply the candidate 
-Perm commission isn't paid out on time. Too many manual layers that you are individually responsible to keep on top of i.e. when invoice is paid out
-Temp commission group bonus is not defined, so you'll have no idea what benchmark you're supposed to hit to make it or what amount you're likely to get
-leadership team provides no support.. no sales, no operations, is inappropriate, two faced, passive aggressive, no open door policy
-Clients come first. Internal staff don't. They remind you of that in every way.
-Internal communication is nonexistent
-Pressure is high and unnecessary (mainly because the leadership team have no idea what they're doing)
-High turnover
-Branch manager says bad things about her own staff behind everyone's back
-HR is not an employee advocate 
-You can't go to anyone if you have a complaint, valid or invalid, because nothing is confidential
-You're expected to work around the clock - no work life balance 
-No internal structure - very chaotic, nobody knows what they're doing or supposed to be doing, leads to lots of bickering because nothing gets done well
-Too many clients, not enough recruiters - service levels suffer
-Recruiters are not given specialties, are generalists, so candidate pools are never diverse enough to support random business, every recruiter is stretched to the thinnest 
-No future vision
-National sales team are too disconnected with internal staff, so promises to clients are unrealistic
-You will go to see clients, who you wished you were a temp for.... you'll hear your manager tell a client how to engage the workforce, how to keep talent, but they don't actually practice it with you or your team!
-ATS is ancient, doesn't work for you, is so limited, outdated 
-Your expectations for a global company will not be met, you'll be shocked at the level of disorganization, back stabbing, unprofessionalism

pros:
I was employed by the Sunderland branch and during my time working for them the management team were very good to work with.
PS: I left before 2014 but I had no earlier date to choose from so the date is incorrect.
cons:
As I was employed by Adecco to work for another company, the work was only planned to run for so many years then our positons would be terminated. So as the project was coming to a end Adecco  offer us a loyalty bonus if we would work until necessary. This bonus was agreed between the company I was working for and with Adecco who I was employed by  in order to encourage the work force to stay to ensure the project ran to the end smoothly. If you followed the agreed contract and stayed until your time was up as agreed with the management then you would receive the "Loyalty bonus" . Great no problems and all signed the contract. BUT when the time came to pay out the AGREED loyalty bonus,  it was paid into our accounts, but for some unknown reason Adecco withdrew the payment out of peoples bank of whom they could do so.  More than 75% the workforce received the payment and the others are left singing for it basically with no explanation as to why. For 7 years now this situation has been going on and still to this day Adecco have NOT given any reason as to why so many were paid and the others were not. But due to legal reasons for  time to claim back the loyalty payment (5 years) has passed. But all this time it has became very clear Adecco were only playing for time. I was one of the persons who qualified for the payment and never received it even though I continued to provided my services long after the qualifying period.
This is not a disgruntled former employee, as this was our fault for letting things go thinking it would all work out and I accept that. Some may be thinking there must be more than meets the eye and there is 2 sides to a coin. But truthfully it is the whole truth and I ask any Adecco management to say other to clear their name.
I do hope people take note and if they are ever offered this Loyalty bonus they do not let things run on as we did. Take legal advice immediately as there are no friends in business.

review_title: OK if you like a hands-off company with trash support and dont need benefits.
pros: The pay rate for hourly staff is decent. The assignments are interesting.
cons: As soon as they are done recruiting you, that is basically the last support you will ever get from them. The support staff will take weeks to reply to emails, nobody answers at the call center, the chat app on the employee portal just says "connecting to agent" for hours but never actually connects. When you finally do get a hold of a human, they are either baseline incompetent and completely unable to answer the simplest questions - or they answer, but the answer contradicts either the policy or the other human you finally got to answer. The benefits are the worst I have ever seen at any company or agency I have ever worked for - I actually pay for my own health insurance because what they offer is so crap, and still expensive, so it was worth it to me to pay a little extra for better coverage. I might as well not have even paid for the dental coverage they provide. The "sick pay" they were so proud of providing is just what is legally required by my state, they aren't really giving us anything they aren't forced to give us. No paid time off / vacation time. They - in theory - have holiday pay, but in reality it is so difficult to qualify for said holiday pay that I have never actually gotten it - nor has anyone I work with - even though I worked Thanksgiving and Christmas and will work New Years, I still haven't "qualified" for Holiday Pay and will only make my base rate for those days. No match on the 401k. No access to trainings or continuing education. No feedback / review process, I have been on assignment for 9 months and have never received any information or insight in to how I am doing, if my assignment has been extended (I'm just planning to show up to work next week and see...?), what the next steps are, etc. I have no mechanism for providing feedback on the people I work with on my assignment (other teammates from other agencies, the client partners i work with, the on-site client manager I "report" to, etc). They changed their benefits enrollment period without giving us sufficient notice, so even if you had wanted to enroll they made that as difficult as possible. They also went through a phase where they just stopped paying me on time, and tried to justify it by saying the policy had changed from payday on wednesday to payday on friday, but if that was true - then the change was not communicated in advance.

job_title: Merchant Terminal Services Specialist in Mason, OH
pros: There are none.  They are completely awful is every respect.
cons:
There are many.  There's never a representative on-site to speak with, none of their staff or recruiters will ever call / email / text / or use any other form of communication to check on their employees..just sit back and collect that money they conveniently shave off of our checks.  God forbid you need representation during the assignment with which you are tasked.  I was recently on an assignment and had an issue with obtaining a contract termination date.  I explained this situation in a very detail-oriented manner with the representatives at Adecco and was given nothing useful in the way of feedback.  I was seeking assistance with this matter and basically received feedback saying there was nothing they could do, nothing they were going to do, and I was on my own.  I elected to end my contract on 01 FEB 2013 on my own accord citing these issues along with the fact that the position I filled with Adecco was initially described as being 1-3 month temp-to-hire, which needless to say, never occurred considering I remained a contractor through the end of the assignment despite many attempts to resolve this issue on my own, then as a last resort, seeking the representation of the contracting agency (Adecco) which I felt should have served on my behalf with the situation.

When I presented the thought of escaping the assignment to obtain something with more of an opportunity of permanence, I was informed that despite what I had endured, nothing could be secured for me until the contract ended and if I wished to remove myself from the contract, I would need to supply 2 days' notice in order to be eligible for other assignments.  I met this criteria considering I supplied 3 days' notice (72 hours) and have contacted this agency 3 times in order to see if other assignments were available.  The last correspondence I sent was today, 12 FEB 2012.  I sent this directly to my staffing contact who placed me on the assignment and her manager.  Approximately an hour after sending this correspondence (none of the previous communications were returned), I received an email which I believe was sent erroneously to my address instead of the representative this was directly sent to and contained the following:


The nerve of this guy  cannot believe it

Sent from my iPhone

Needless to say, I'm beside myself.  This is a descriptor of how customer / client relations are trending in business nowadays.  It's very sad that when a legitimate concern is presented, this is the response that is received and that people within the Adecco agency speak ill of their contractors  such as this.  I have read some pretty negative reviews of Adecco's personnel, but never dreamed I would experience this firsthand.  I believe this is a clear indicator that there is no intention of this Adecco branch office to place me on future assignments.

pros: I had a recruiter that seemed genuinely interested in getting me jobs.

pros: There is a lot of flexibility with scheduling when you need to take time off. 19 days of PTO per year and it's not tracked well. If you are in a good office there is a lot of team work and fun atmosphere.
cons:
The work environment is very unstable. They sell you on the idea of high commissions and professional staffing when in reality 99% of your job is general staffing including warehousing positions. Commissions are very hard to come by if you are in the general staffing side. There is VERY little support from upper management. If your branch is not doing well they do not help to build it they just play the blame game and keep pushing numbers. The mentality is "hang in there" and "things will get better" when in reality this is something that upper management continues to say to everyone but is not doing anything to make it better. Adecco corporate ideas and values are not carried down throughout the branches and each branch is on its own and acts independently. They have created a thorough training manual but it is almost impossible to follow when you are working alone in a branch and expected to carry out all branch procedures on your own. Upper management acts very re-actively to issues rather than proactively. 

Another huge issue is the standard set for associates that are seeking employment, with a lot of low paid positions and very little standards set it has become a very hostile work environment. Employees are frequently calling yelling, screaming, threatening, and cursing at the staff in the branch.

job_title: Training and Development Specialist in Shakopee, MN
pros: Really can't think of a single one.  They pay me on time sometimes but that is about it...
cons:
Where to even start!?!!

I have been contracted through adecco for about a year now, the experience has been horrible - from the beginning to right now.  I should have seen the weiting on the wall when they gave me the wrong time for my interview.  Thankfully I was not the first interviewer they had sent over and my now-company was very understanding, saying that they had given all of the job seekers the wrong time, deapite my company trying to correct it multiple times.  They also quotted me the wrong amount for my hourly pay, so I was dissapointed when I recieved my first pay heck and discovered it was quiet a bit smaller than I'd been antisipating.  as much as I love my job now, if I'd have known the actual wage then, I doubt I would have accepted the offer.  

Multiple times over the past year I have had my paychecks missed.  I have had to call and email every time for multiple days just to get a response.  And when I do, no one ever knows what's going on.  The worst example was when I had a missed paycheck for three weeks and was unable to get in touch with anyone despite leaving multiple voicemails and sending tons of emails to all the contacts I had.  They eventually called me back and 'apologized' that it had taken them so long to get back to me, saying that all of my voicemails were going to a phone they didnt use...i had been calling the number listed on there website and every employees email signiture, so I find that very odd.

Perhaps part of their problem is that they cannot seem to keep anyone employed.  In the year that I have been with them I have had at least 5 or 6 different account managers come and go.  At this point I have no idea who my point of contact is.

The most recent example of their incompetence was just this week:  my job offered me a promotion.  Adecco contacted me and let me know and I told them I had several questions before I accepted.  Instead of answering my questions, they emailed my contingent labor group and told them I accepted, without ever even contacting me back!  It took me two days tp get through to then again that I needed my questions answered before I could accept anything.  I recieved one email saying they would look into it two days ago, and since then not a word, despite me attempting to contact them via phone and email multiple times.

I know these people work on commision... i've worked on commision before too so I know the appeal of quickly closing a deal and moving on.  However these are people's livlihoods that they are messing with.

I still haven't been able to give my company a straight answer, and it's looking like the promotion I was offered might be off the table soon, all becuase Adecco was unable to pick up a phone.

Needless to say I am EXTREMELY dissapointed in this company and will be informing everyone I know to stear clear.  Being a manager at a call center I had worked with many different temp agencies before, and none of them were even close to this level of failure.

review_title: At first it was something that seemed promising.
pros: Pay for Computershare contracted employees seemed pretty good...location was not too far away, but with some distance. Promised 40hrs in the add I applied to.

The moment we get their we are informed that it is not in fact a 40hr work week, but instead 37.5(you have 30min lunches that take out 2.5hrs from your check)

It’s not the people inside working with you that are the problem. It’s the computershare/Adecco management and their malicious ways of rolling o a “new policy” that holds no possible way of retrieving it. When asked why terminate me? The woman simply said computershare policy to deflect the question of why the policy was not sent out or communicated to the entire floor(staff) . When reminded of how many weeks and MONTHS it’s been since  I and the rest of my coworkers have been practically begging the representative to email us this alleged “policy”. I even brought it up to my amazing TL and yet no response. Even when confronted with termination of my contract for an imaginary policy that was never sent out. This Edison location was one of the worst experiences as far as micromanaging and harassment to hard workers whom they put in these training positions to them be devalued by imaginary rules. The company does not value you.  
In a long story short, we were basically called thieves after money went missing from the higher up’s purse. 
Instead of reviewing the (2) cameras her purse sits under, she instead proceeds to call her 80 staff members passive aggressively calling us thieves and horribly “trying” to relate by using words like “desperate” and “hard times” when we all take pride in how we work and how we conduct  ourselves. 

The ever-changing environment spiel is just an excuse to say I can tell you all the wrong information and therefore show my indecisiveness as a company, however I am going to continue to care about all the wrong things instead of communication between the teams to have us all move on one accord with no miscommunications, which is what matters the most. When we all were on the same page the productivity boomed. The bad part is people literally made rules up as they went, and to solidify it they never put it in writing or let any of us PHYSICALLY SEE any policy.

pros: I worked as a recruiter for Adecco and I loved it when I first started. Leadership was great and we were awarded in 2014 for the greatest profit increase in the region. It was a great "work hard, "play hard" environment.
cons:
We had divisional and regional leadership changes and everything went down hill from there. They treat their colleagues horribly in the Minneapolis/St. Paul Branches.  

- Our hours were constantly changing (standard 7a-5p to "retail hours").

- Unrealistic work performance expectations. 
***Adecco's performance metrics were not conducive to the goals of their clients. I can't submit the right people to the right jobs if I am expected to just "submit away" to meet a 24 hour or a COB SLA. I can't do my job for the client when my time is spent taking 100 inbound calls because payroll can't get it together, be on a training call, babysit the background check vendor, deal with glitches in the CRM, transfer the same employee data into 3 different programs, waste hours gathering paper docs for an audit to scan and email for 30 employees who were on a ramp up assignment and worked with a recruiter who was gone before I even started working there, schedule 40 appointments a day and make 100 outbound calls for sourcing.***

- No transparency.

- Consistently scheduled salaried employees 44 hours a week without OT pay.

- Had to work from home every night to take care of the back end stuff that I couldn't do in the office.

- They take advantage of employees - the cheaper the better. 

- Management just recently gave a 3.5-4 day notice to all their employees that the St. Paul branch was closing. It closed last Friday, August 26th.

In the ONE year since this divisional leadership changed, These Minneapolis/St. Paul branches have gone through 23 recruiters (all of which stuck it out a minimum of 1-2 years), 3 branch managers, 2 Regional VPs, 1 Regional Operations Manager, 2 Sales Reps, and 3 admin. Of those 34 people who have left this company in that one year, 3 were eliminated, the rest quit voluntarily.

pros: Adecco hires good people so the office environment was a good one.
cons: Adecco is an organization that uses talented staff to their fullest capability while treating everyone as expendable and replaceable. There is a core team in upper management and other than that all staff are seen as workhorses who must spend endless hours ensuring information is audit compliant and working to correct information in a mismanaged database while not having time to actually perform recruitment with any level of professionalism. Adecco frequently partners with companies that treat employees poorly and is complicit with the mistreatment of workers simply to achieve a profit. Many times I felt that I was being asked to compromise my principles in order to make the client happy and taking advantage of individuals who are in a position where they must work manual labour jobs with unreasonable expectations of both physical requirements and compliance wtih Employment Standards.

job_title: Vehicle Operator in Mountain View, CA
pros:
I wish I could say something as simple as I get timely responses on urgent issues, but I can't. 
I wish I could say that they offer adequate health care, but I can't. 
I even wish I could say something as simple as I get paid on time, but they can't even be bothered to do that on a consistent bases.
cons:
Everything about this place is a con. 
Management is lazy, slow, and incompetent. Issues never get resolved. You're bombarded with excuses and semantics and never offered actual solutions, all while shifting the blame onto a middle man.
They even respond with nasty and demeaning messages when you need help with time sensitive issues.
My coworkers and I expressed our grievances about the inconsistent (and sometimes altogether missing) paychecks. Only to hear that they know they are terrible with payroll...and that's it. No solutions!
The healthcare provider is pointless, with insanely high premiums for little to no coverage. If you try to leave they force you to stay enrolled for an ENTIRE YEAR. 
On-site office hours are constantly changing to the point where it is difficult to keep up, and even when you are able to, you may find it impossible to find them because they are hiding somewhere.
Negligence is on a whole other level. They will go days without reaching out to inform you if there's a problem with your paycheck or timecard, and lots of times won't reach out until it's too late. 
Don't expect to make a living working here, because they like to make sure it's closed to impossible. 
No paternity/maternity leave, so if you're having a kid your on your own. 
Don't even expect to get your expenses back. You can go weeks, and months without hearing anything back. And once you do, you'd be lucky to hear that you even get your money back.
The were the middle man during my stint with Waymo, and every resource was delegated to another OTHER middle man. Have a complaint or concern? Or worse, a time sensitive issue? Start swimming through the sea of middle men until you've tried yourself out.
